The brisket was good and they included fatty and lean pieces, but the memory of the superb brisket from Little Miss BBQ still lingers in my memory as one of the best I've had.

The sides were excellent. The roasted corn also had some smoked flavor and the coleslaw was crisp, tangy and refreshing.

Overall it was a good meal and I do like how they have more convenient hours and better atmosphere than Little Miss BBQ. I will be back for more BBQ!

author: Ray P.
review text:
Woo hoo! A solid five stars for some of the best BBQ I've had.  I've had my fair share of great BBQ experiences from all four corners of the US, including states and cities traditionally known for this great American dish.  I have to say that what I had at Bobby Q knocked it out of the park.

I had the two-meat combo comprising of baby backs and brisket.  According to my server, these two are "the ones that keeps the lights on" for the restaurant.  I totally see why.  Their meals are smoked in house for about a full day.  Combined with their special rubs, not only does this impart a great taste but the meats were some of the most tender and moist I've had.  The brisket was melt in your mouth tender while the pork ribs fell off the bone with little effort.  The BBQ sauce used was just right - not too overpowering the taste of the meat, not too sweet or "ketchupy".  Even the sides of broccolini and roasted brussel sprouts were spot on and complimented the entrees well..

I lucked out and came just before Happy Hour was done so I took advantage and ordered a couple of appys.  The buffalo cauliflower was exceptional (gotta try making this at home!) as was the beef brisket tacos.

I have to say that the service was great.  All of the staff, from the hostess, to my server, to the manager, Joanne, were friendly and helpful.

Easily one of the best for BBQ I've had.

author: Ramon F.
review text:
It's Monday afternoon and for some reason or another some restaurants close on Monday. So we just happen to be near Bobby Q and it was past lunch time, made a last minute decision eat here. Besides we haven't been here in a while. We didn't have to wait long to be seated since the lunch crowd was gone. We were seated by Arianna, our server and soon after we were seated she handed us our menu. Since it was not dinner yet and after lunch, I decided to go for a smaller meal. I went for the Sliced BBQ Prime Beef Brisket sandwich and I chose the baked potato as my side with all the fixings. As we were waiting for our orders cornbread was placed at our table with soft butter to spread in the cornbread. They were delicious to say the least. My dish was brought out and it was all I could do to stop focusing on my Brisket sandwich. Let me tell you I was not disappointed with my dish. Everything was cooked to perfection and by the time I was done I had eaten every morsel of goodness. I must of been hungry but, it was the way everything was prepared. I will return and try something different next time.
As a jester of advice, whenever you check in to Bobby Q or other restaurants that offer a discount on your check in, tell your server and show them, so that you are given the discount.

author: Dwayne O.
review text:
Ordered the Combination of Half a Slab of Baby Back Ribs and Catfish, along with Baked Potato,  Mac and Cheese and Roasted Corn. Quite a complete meal that we shared it among 2 people and still could not eat all of it. The Baby Back Ribs were super tender and moist and as a cut each rib, the meat would just fall off the bone. The Catfish was good, would have been nice with some tarter sauce. The sides were average, not great, but not bad. The baked potato was loaded with butter, sour cream, chives and Bacon so that was a winner, the mac and cheese was good but when the waitress said that is their recommendation and the best side, I expected a little more. The Roasted Corn when we ordered expected a ear of corn roasted over a grill, but what we received was an inch of 2 ends of corn on the cob and loose corn kernels in a small bowl which could have been corn from a can.

Salmon Dinner was a generous slab of fish and was well prepared. It was grilled and had a good crisp grilled skin which was very good and it came with 2 sides which my daughter choose the mac and cheese plus vegetables.

Cornbread is very good and the waiter was generous enough to give us another basket.

At the end if your meal, wait for the sugar donuts! Served warm they are killer!

Overall experience was very good with service and ability to park while restaurant was busy.

author: Michael M.
review text:
Let me start my review with one word and I'm not even sure if it's even a real word, WOW! There is no hype with the reviews here. They are all legit! The 2 meat platters are amazing, the appetizers rock, and the drinks were perfectly mixed.

Blake was our server and he was very attentive. The food came out fast, hot an delicious.

Jack, the general manage personally came out to check on us and to make sure we were 100% satisfied.

The four of us are all from New Jersey and this restaurant made the trip all the way to Phoenix Arizona worthwhile. Keep up the great work staff!

author: Jeanne B.
review text:
My girlfriend from Oregon and I had a delicious meal at Bobby Qs restaurant tonight. Initially, we had a minor situation with the menus each having different prices. The manager was very gracious and offered us the lower-priced menu.  Very professional and very friendly.
LeeAnne was our server and she was a 10.  ‼‼My girlfriend ordered a steak sandwich. The steak was grilled to perfection with a glazed caramelized sauce that brought out the steak's flavors. It was thick and juicy and so flavorful covered in grilled mushrooms served with onion rings so tasty I ordered one to go.
Their potato soup is almost a meal in itself. It is so flavorful with cheese and bacon and chopped onions and potatoes I could've eaten another bowl instead I got one to go.
Bobby Qs gives you a small bag of homemade donuts to thank you for enjoying their restaurant. Give it a try for sure.
Second review:  treated friends today to Bobby Qs for burgers and steak sandwiches. Kyle served us and he was beyond on top of keeping us satisfied. Actually I was the one who got treated today.  Manager Taylor himself took care of a minor problem I had with my steak. He solved the issue as fast as humanly possible.  He gave me the BEST customer service ever in any restaurant I've eaten. Food so wonderful; service the same.
Third review: my girlfriend took me to barbecue yesterday for my birthday. We wanted to go out in odd times so it would be so crowded and noisy. There are special was a prime rib sandwich with one of their yummy sides and by the time we got there it was sold out. We split a brisket and pork sandwich with a loaded potato and I have enough for dinner. The barbecue sauce is divine. My birthday dessert was a brownie and ice cream that I took to go because I was so full. This is one of my favorite restaurants in north Phoenix. I have never had a bad meal here

author: Benjamin C.
review text:
Three Meat Combo Platter: Brisket, Baby Backs, Chicken w/ Mac n Cheese & Straw Fries
Service: 10/10
Location: 10/10
Food: 11/10
The Q rolls as an appetizer will leave you speechless and the complimentary donuts for dessert will finish your meal perfectly.

Honestly the whole menu is fire.

author: Rashmi G.
review text:
When I saw quite a few of my Yelp friends checked in at Bobby Q, I definitely couldn't pass up a chance to go. We went on a Friday night and the wait for a table was about an hour and a half. This was a little bit longer than expected, however we figured we would grab a drink and wait. After seeing how large the drinks were that others around us had ordered, we decided on just one cocktail called Shipwrecked. It was large and pretty sweet with a blue raspberry-coconut flavor. Since this was the type of fruity drink I typically gravitate towards, I was satisfied and would get it again.

Their estimate on the wait time was fairly accurate so about an hour & a half later, we were seated at a table on their outside patio. Our waiter was friendly and came by our table immediately. He went over the menu items and suggested some of the meat plates and sides. I ended up getting a Pulled BBQ Chicken Sandwich with a side of Mac & Cheese (which multiple servers seemed to be recommending) and my fiancé got a three meat plate with the baked potato and mashed potatoes. While we waited, we were brought out some warm cornbread and butter to enjoy, and a short while later, our food arrived.

After tasting a little bit of everything that we got, I wish I would have ordered one of the red meats instead of the chicken sandwich only because it was so plain compared to the other items. I'm not a huge fan of red meat which I was pleased to see chicken on the menu, but the red meat had the actual BBQ flavor I was hoping to find. All the side items were good; I personally liked the mashed potatoes the most but my fiancé liked the mac and cheese the most. The chicken sandwich plate and side was small enough for one to finish entirely but we had some leftovers from the three meat plate.

After we were done with our meals, we were brought a small bag with some cinnamon sugar covered donuts. I had seen a couple of people making them fresh at the front of the restaurant when we walked in, so this was definitely a nice & unique treat.

Overall, I would definitely be up for coming back here and giving some of the other menu items a try ... 4.5 stars, just not quite 5.

author: Nichole M.
review text:
Since we loved Bobby Q in Mesa, we decided to see what the "Original" location in Phoenix had to offer. I don't know who runs this place or the other, but I'd LOVE to meet him/her or them. The service at this place it top notch and far surpasses that of any 5 star, fine dining establishments I've ever been to. I am a firm believer that food may come up short from time to time. Maybe a recipe wasn't followed. Maybe there's a new cook in the kitchen. Maybe they are so slammed the kitchen cant keep up, etc.. It's a bummer when that happens but most often people will return to try it again. But... a server is on stage, in front of their guests, until the last curtain call. They really have no room for error without getting scrutinized and skinned alive. And they tend to take the hit for the entire restaurant. If the food is bad, for some reason it's easier for people to take it out on the server. If it took an hour to get a table, somehow it's the servers fault. If an entree was missed and didn't make it out to the table...yep it's the server's fault. Am I wrong?
Well here is where I'm going with this. The service at Bobby Q is so cream of the crop, that  in the unfortunate event of any one of the above mentioned scenarios, I can't foresee it ever being an issue.
Our server Donald, was more than just an order taker. He was a true experience maker, and we had the best time with him. I asked him about a couple of cocktails I was torn on. He was honest about one of them, the Watermelon Cooler, and let me know it's not for everyone and it gets sent back quite a bit. I ordered it and LOVED it. It tasted like a Jalapeno infused, Watermelon Margarita. I love spicy margaritas and this cocktail was right up my alley!
The food was also superb. I had beef ribs as well as 1/2 rack baby backs, accompanied with Mashed Potatoes and Mac N CHeese!
PSA: There is absolutely no dainty way to eat the beef ribs. Just accept the facts, get in touch with your inner Caveman, and go to town! Nom, Nom, Nom... while you're feasting, try to remember you are in public, people may be watching, so keep the growling to a minimum.
At the end of our meal, we were so full, we regretfully declined dessert. We did however find a tiny bit of room for the complimentary mini donuts. I actually asked if we could order some to go. To my pleasant surprise, they sell them by the dozen! And, to my ultimate surprise our server brought us a few extra donuts, told us not to leave, and came back with a scoop of vanilla ice cream!! Whhaaaaaaat?? Omg... mind blown and super yummy! All in all Bobby Q. has it together from start to finish and you will not be disappointed! Be sure to ask for Donald, he's one of the best!

author: Luciana L.
review text:
Native Texan checking in and this place is solid.  Not as good as Texas bbq but the best we've had since moving to the valley.  It was so good in fact that hubs wants to inquire about holding a private event there for work.  So yeah, not bad at all!

We shared a 3 meat plate with brisket, baby back ribs and pulled pork.  Out of the 3, the brisket was my least favorite because I thought it was a bit dry but hubs didn't seem to think so.  He thought they were all pretty dang good.  My 3 year old devoured his mac and cheese.  It was pretty creamy and delicious.

We ordered the cornbread as an after thought so I was pretty full by the time it got to our table but it was so delicious I ate a whole one plus some.  It tastes almost like a desert because of the sweetness.  Perfection.

The decor is nice - very casual and bbq-like.  Service was good, too.  If you like bbq, you definitely need to check this place out!

author: Carrie F.
review text:
Defiantly worth the hype! For drinks I ordered the sangria and my Bf got the two IPA's on draft.  My sangria was good came in a glass mason jar.  My boyfriend enjoyed both IPA's.

Appetizer we ordered the Q ROLLS tasty deep fried brisket with a Bbq dipping sauce and spicy dipping sauce as well-I enjoyed the bbq as it was a little sweet how I like it!

Main course we split the prime rib & bbq chicken combo.  Combo comes with a potato and two sides.  We ordered the MAC AND CHEESE and OH MY GOD it was prob the best Mac and cheese I've had in a while---five stars alone!!!!. The other side was the veggies...eh wasn't a fan . The veggies they chose were onions? Squash and peppers, to me that just wasn't what I was expecting- I had in mind broccoli or cauliflower? Seemed like an odd choice

For  dessert we ordered the mud pie to go !

As a bonus they give you some homemade donuts for the road ( I was too stuffed but my bf said they were amazing)

Overall good pick, good music, and good service! Will be back for sure!

author: Dana A.
review text:
This was an interesting find. Upon arriving in Phoenix, i obv checked yelp to see what the best eats were. Based on the reviews, this seemed like a no brainer.

Its basically an off the highway stop for grub. The outdoor eating area looked more appealing than inside. The service was great but i just wasnt crazy about the bbq or drinks unfortunately. We shared the Q rolls and a both ordered the pulled pork sandwich. The Q rolls tasted like they were from Applebees and the pulled pork just wasnt juicy at all.  The mac n cheese was actually pretty good. Portions are pretty large also.

The drinks were 95% mixer. They give you unlimited cornbread which was different than your average. It was a circle of  soft and buttery goodness. They also give you free donuts at the end of your meal. These were the winner for me. THEY WERE SO GOOOOD!

However, the service was great! Our waiter was very attentive and offered if we wanted more cornbread and whatever else we needed.

I unfortunately would not return here again. It just seems like people like it cause its a convenient "real food" stop on the highway. Its definitely not the best bbq iv ever had and it is certainty not worth the hype. If i do return,  itll be for those damn donuts!

author: Keilah H.
review text:
This place is incredible! I live in Scottsdale & honestly I'm a little weary about the Phoenix area so it's really rare that I even come out here but when I saw this place online I knew I had to make the trip & check it out.

Where do I begin? This place reminds me of a fancy renovated barn. It's nestled in a hidden parking lot surrounded by beautiful trees. It looked like a little oasis with the misters on outside & string lights. They also have a cute little American truck outside you can take pics with!

The mood inside the restaurant was just right with a very prestine atmosphere, dim lighting, and an OFF THE CHARTS playlist with amazing country & classic rock hits. I definitely enjoyed singing along while eating their incredible house made sweet hot cornbread. Definitely some of the best cornbread I ever had. The booths seated along the windows are my fave.

Now for the best part, THE FOOD. My man & I shared the chicken fried chicken with mashed potatoes & an extra side of mac n cheese. Everything was perfect! These chefs really know what they are doing. The chicken was so tender like butter and fried to perfection, so crispy. Not too hard, not too soft it was just right! I loved how the mashed potatoes were made mixed in with the skin, those r my favorite kind. The gravy was incredible and the Mac n cheese OMG! Amazing!! Everything was so hot & fresh.

Our waiter Harrison was delightful. He was very knowledgeable about the restaurant, menu & how the meats are prepared & cooked. He got our order in & brought it out in a timely fashion, and came back to check on us often. Upon leaving there were about 5 different employees all telling us to have a great night & thanks for coming in. All very eager to wish us well. Very fine service!!!

I love this place and will definitely be back!! :)

author: Sylvia O.
review text:
Winner winner BBQ dinner! Drove into town for a volleyball tournament and wanted to eat some BBQ in Phoenix.

Bobby Q did not disappoint!!! First of all, the complementary corn bread was freak'n delicious. It was soft, moist, and fluffy, if that's even possible, almost like cornbread cake.

My boyfriend ordered the Smoked Jumbo Texas Beef Ribs. Oh my lanta those ribs are incredibly tender and flavorful. I wish we ordered a second plate lol. I ordered the meatloaf (only available on Thursdays) which was also really good. Portions are big enough to bring leftovers home for another meal.

End your meal with complimentary homemade sugar donuts!

author: Lisa M.
review text: Great bbq in a not so great part of town. But don't let that stop you. Big parking lot and a popular place that attests to its good food. Reservations are on Yelp. We shared a three meat platter but only ordered two meats: Beef rib and double brisket and chose Mac and cheese and beans.  We had their cornbread as a starter and asked for more. The beef rib was soooo good and had a wonderfully rich flavor. The brisket was a good smoky flavor and very tender. Mac and cheese was yummy but the beans were a little crunchy although the flavor was great. I asked to try both the spicy and sweet bbq sauce. Both were good but I like the spicy more! Our server was Dustin and he was great!  But he wasn't alone. The restaurant staff seemed to work as a team with everyone happy to help. Very impressed.

author: Liz P.
review text:
I went here with some friends tonight - I'm in Phoenix for work and they both live in Phoenix. One of them liked the BBQ here so we decided to try it.

Ironically, I thought all of the food here was fantastic except my pulled pork sandwich was lacking. We started off with the Q rolls, which are rolls stuffed with brisket, and we also had fried zucchini, which was delicious. The zucchini was kind of thin, which I've never seen before with fried zucchini. and it came with what looked to be a homemade ranch sauce.

I also ordered the pineapple drink for my cocktail which was very delicious, and my friends got a Mai Tai and a sangria.

The restaurant also provides complimentary cornbread and it was fantastic, it was more of like a cornbread cake and it came with butter. Our waitress actually brought us a second helping of this because we all loved it so much.

For my meal, I got the pulled pork sandwich with mashed potatoes. You are allowed to choose one side and they have many to choose from. There was not much sauce on the pulled pork and I thought it was fine but nothing special. The mashed potatoes were very creamy and delicious though. It also came with a pickle. My friends got a half rack of baby back ribs as well as the pulled pork plate, and it looked like she had more sauce on her pulled pork versus my sandwich.

Waitservice was also good. The reason this place gets four stars for me and not five is because prices are pretty high, my sandwich was $17 and our appetizers were 14 to $15. Plates range from like $23 to $29. The other reason is what I said previously, I feel like a barbecue place should have great barbecue and my sandwich was just okay.

That being said, everything else we ate here was fantastic so I would return when in town. I forgot to mention that the waitress surprised us with two complimentary orders of their mini donuts for us to take home, as well; I ate one while it was hot and fresh, at the restaurant, and it was delicious.

author: Lee D.
review text:
1/16/22

Quality/Quantity -
Whole Hog Heaven - Beef Ribs, Baby Back Ribs, Beef Brisket, Shredded Pork
Beer Fries, Pecan ColeSlaw, Mac & Cheese.
Upgraded to Beer Fries for $1.50 more - worth it!
Southern Fried Chicken
Free Corn Bread - some of the best cornbread we have had.
Free Donuts - make sure you ask for them! They can forget to give it to customers at the end of the meal.

They also have a gluten free menu.
Cocktail menu.
M-F daily specials.
Catering.

Atmosphere -
This place is HUGE.
Happier Hour M-F 2 to 5pm - look forward to trying it in the future.
Inside and outside seating.
Cool Decor inside and outside.
Easy private parking.

Additionally, offers the following private parties: corp luncheons, holiday parties, birthdays, anniversaries, weddings, rehearsal dinners, etc

Service -
Not sure if Claudia was new, but she did a good job.
Accommodated all our requests.
Came back often to check on us.
Anything she could not answer, she asked her other team members.
Also, another person came by often to refill our waters.

Price - $106.43 + Tip.

Owner Suggestion - Congrats on your 3 locations and your success since 2005.  What a great history from your restaurant and entrepreneur starting at 15 years of age.

Btw, the Happier sign in your restaurant reads 2-5pm, but on your receipt it states 2-6pm.
Also on your website it has different Happy Hour info on the same web page???
Bar & Patio Only
M-F 3-6pm and M-F 2-5pm
Very confusing.

author: Diko K.
review text:
I've travelled to more than half of the US states and this place has one of the top ribs compared to anywhere else I've been.

The positive review will start from the name of the place because it's extremely clever.

We tried the ribs and some of everything on the menu. The ribs, brisket, and sausages were just some of the items we tried. Very nice design as well.

author: Megan T.
review text: AMAZING FOOD!! Fast service, our waitress Ellie was awesome- always checking on us. But wow, the food was so good. I'm not a meat person so I got the BBQ chicken salad (& it was so tasty!!) but my boyfriend and my dad both chose the "pick 3 meats" they loved it. I especially loOOooOved the complimentary cornbread & doughnuts at the beginning & end!! So fresh & so delicious! Amazing experience overall! Highly highly recommend! Thank you again Ellie for being an awesome waitress ! :)

author: Rashi T.
review text:
This place deserves nothing less than 5 stars .What an experience and we couldn't have come at a better day as the two of us were starving after a day of hiking and roaming around in the sun . I want to first preface by saying that this is not a place you come with a half empty stomach because you would regret not eating more.
The secret behind Bobby Q's barbeque lies within the slow cooking process over Tennessee hickory wood paired with the perfect blend of spices such as the special dry rub .The result is succulent hand-pulled pork, smoky sausage links, fork-tender brisket, and ribs that fall right off the bone. Three different ribs are offered (St. Louis, Texas, and baby back) as well as chicken, salmon, burgers, and hand-cut steaks. The sides are a great accompaniment, but the meat is the show stopper here. I was not a fan of the Mac and cheese but everything else was top-notch. We finished our meal with the ginormous sized Mud pie and couldn't finish the whole thing even though we really tried. The service was top-notch, and they even gave us a bag of fresh fried donuts, dusted with cinnamon sugar on the house. Pricing was extremely reasonable for the amount and quality of food.
The restaurant itself is huge and has a charmingly-rustic vibe and features reclaimed woodwork with exposed brick walls, antique gas lamps, and tall vintage French doors. The outdoor patio was such a nice-cute space but we were too hungry to wait for a seat outside so we settled for the inside seating .

author: Michelle O.
review text:
This restaurant was really good. They handled our party of 15 flawlessly. We had 2 servers that were on top of everything. They were so nice!

The food was so good. I got the three meat combo. The chicken was tender and juicy and the brisket was so tender. I would recommend this restaurant and I will definitely be coming back here when I'm back in AZ.

author: Georgie M.
review text:
Okay, I can now die in peace.

For my eyes (and stomach) have feasted upon the table of plenty, here at Booby Q's!

The three of us came here one Wednesday evening and thank God we had reservations. The hostess told someone who waltz'd in, that it was over an hours or so wait time. LOL

So why the long wait? The food here is amazing.  It's as good as anything I've ever had in KC, Memphis, Texas or the south-side of Chicago.  Though admittedly, I am very partial to Dreamland in Mobile, AL.

You can argue over dry rub, or wet rub, but in end it's only the finished brisket or ribs that we should care about and Bobby Q's does it, oh so well.

We had Brisket Q-Rolls, Onion Brick, Burgers, Baby Back Ribs, Mud Pie and more. Everything was delicious.

Expect to spend $25 to $40 each, depending upon what extras you get and how thirty you are.

Enjoy!

author: Thomas R.
review text:
Was in town looking for some decent food around the neighborhood and stumbled upon this not so hidden gem.

Nice sized parking lot, outdoor seating available that probably doesn't see much action in the summer time lol. Pretty big inside with plenty of seating. The interior is kinda dim, we walked through a random room to get to our table in the bar room area. Has a bit or an Adam's family vibe to the decor but not too spooky, just different.. very clean inside, restrooms as well. I chuckled when I saw ice in the men's urinals but it might not be as amusing for you lol.

The waitress was on her A game and got our order in quick and the food came out in a timely manner. The cornbread and butter was a great first step in the right direction. The brisket was everything I hoped it would be and the thin consistency bbq sauce was a nice compliment to the flavor. The chicken wasn't bad at all but I feel I could've picked a different side. The waitress suggested it and I dont regret the order but im anxious to try the other options available. The mac n cheese was a 3/5, not bad at all but not my favorite place for Mac.  Overall the meal was solid and well rounded.

I enjoyed seeing a mix of all types of people in here which showed that many different types of palates enjoy the food here including myself. Service was stellar and the price wasn't bad at all..

Sidenote- my kid ate before we came and he had no plans on eating but he got some shoe string fries and said they were perfect for the lifetime fry connoisseur lol.

author: Jason R.
review text: The BBQ was great. Beef ribs, brisket, baby backs...are all that. The pecan slaw wasn't special, good slaw with sprinkles of pecan. The after meal free fresh doughnuts were the bomb.

author: Diana B.
review text: Food was awful k,not that great have me heartburn. They allow babies to scream & cry  and not stop. It was annoying

author: Daw M.
review text:
AHHHH-MAZING bbq. I am soooo happy we stop and got lunch here on our road trip to the Grand Canyon. This place has amazing brisket and BABY BACK RIBS.

Definitely get the baby back ribs. The beef ribs are less meaty but still good. And chicken is average :)

The cornbread is good and the apple pie was HUGE, but wasn't my cup of hot mess  

Wonderful service from Blake. Thank you for an amazing experience!

author: Angie T.
review text: It was just okay. I was so excited to finally dine here. The hostess and the serving staff are awesome! Everyone was kind and my food came out very quickly. The problem is that it did not taste very good. I'm wondering if part of their process includes baking the meat?  It could also be the meat quality that is causing the beef to taste more like pork. It just wasn't as good as they have the potential for.  If you like real Texas bbq you won't be satisfied no matter how many stars they have on Yelp. I threw most of my food away.  I'm sorry, but I can recommend this place.

author: Rachel B.
review text:
Still delicious! This time I went for the Q Rolls as my entire meal! Good decision - if I say so myself! I did order a cup of baked potato soup - soup of the day. It wasn't incredible - just okay.

My eating companion enjoyed the Beef Ribs. He stated they were tender, juicy, and flavorful. He was impressed that they served them and prepared them very well. Further, the BBQ sauces are a medley of perfection.

We arrived at 8:30 on a Saturday night, it was raining, we had no wait time for a table! The servers were professional. AND THE DONUTS WERE THE PERFECT CONCLUSION!

I highly recommend!

author: Bobby G.
review text: We highly recommend Bobby Q's. Last night we had excellent service our server Ryan went above and beyond and made our dining experience very pleasant and memorable. We started off with the Fried Zucchini which was one of the best we have ever had because of the light breading. Our entrées were the Prime Rib French Dip with Beer Fries and the Southern Fried Chicken both were extremely mouth watering. Our dessert Miss McGees Mud Pie was perfect for such a hot day and a huge portion. We highly recommend going to Bobby Q's

author: Leslie G.
review text:
Can we talk about the smokehouse burger and how fantastic it is?   Burger perfectly cooked. Add on that cheddar cheese, amazing bacon, topped with fried onion strings! Oh my!!

The fries were a bit disappointing. Not cooked near enough.  The potato salad on the other hand was amazing!  

The brisket sandwich was delicious and the Mac n cheese was alright.  The burger was definitely the star along with that potato salad!!

author: Mikhala S.
review text:
Had an awesome meal here! Outdoor seating was quaint- definitely recommend making a reservation ahead of time.

The complimentary cornbread was delish, and we loved the BBQ meat platters and sides we got.

author: Lisa D.
review text: I'm not a huge bar b que fan, but if I was, this would be my favorite restaurant! The corn bread is amazing and the service is top notch. The decor is really cute as well and goes perfect with the country bbq restaurant vibe. I had the chicken BBQ salad which comes in a small or large portion size. The salad tasted very fresh and the dressing was delicious. My boyfriend had the brisket sandwich. Perhaps the best part of the meal were the free donuts that were brought to our table after our dinner. This is definitely a restaurant to check out if you love bbq.

author: Vianca H.
review text:
Bobby Q's has one of the best bbq in town. My favorite personally is their happy hour specials, which includes lots of my menu recommendations. The tomatillo brisket Mac & cheese is packed with flavor and super rich, it cures the soul. I'd also recommend the machaca nachos and the bbq sliders.

Unexpectedly Bobby Q's has some really good tacos! On Tuesday's they are are only $2!

Cheers friends!

author: Cathy H.
review text:
Came here on a Sunday afternoon after a long and hot hike. Ordered the whole hog heaven to share between my boyfriend and I. We got the baby back ribs, St Louis ribs, pulled pork, brisket. It also came with three sides - cole slaw, mashed potato's, and roasted corn. Everything was good but the St. Louis ribs stood out since they were literally fall off the bone. Cornbread was another highlight - complimentary from the restaurant and soooo delicious!

Service was quick. Cyrai was a great server - even bringing me extra cornbread to go! Portion size was good - we had leftovers to bring home. Highly recommend checking out if you are in the area. If you check in on Yelp, you get an additional 10% off!

author: Natalie B.
review text:
The food at Bobby Q's never disappoints! Our meal always starts with fresh hot cornbread. The quality of the BBQ meats are so good. I got the pulled pork and my friend got the chicken. You could definitely tell the meats are slow cooked cause they were so tender. The Mac n cheese I couldn't get enough of. Very creamy and full of flavor. Then at the end of your meal you automatically get a bag of mini donuts. Who could be mad at free mini fresh and hot donuts!

The only reason I'm giving them 4 stars out of 5 is because the service during our last visit was very disappointing. Since it was a Saturday evening we made a reservation for 6:15. We got to the restaurant at 6:10 and there was a line just to get in to the host. We stood in line for 10 mins. Once we checked in they told us we would be seated shortly. We didn't get seated until 6:45pm. 30 mins after our reservation! What's the point of taking reservations if you're not going to stick to them?!?! Then our server seemed to be handling too many tables. He was very nice but he wasn't very attentive and it was a wait to get anything. Even to pay! He took our cards and took 10 mins just to come back with our receipts. I understand times are tough right now but this type of service can be prevented.

author: James S.
review text:
Luv this place eat there 3-4 times a month just ate there 10/08/2021 for dinner 1/2 baby back ribs platter 1 soda $45.00 with tip.  Luv the food just not sure the price is right!!!
Went there 3 weeks ago out the door with $10 tip $37.00 I know this place is great. But was sad to see how much they have raised the price.  Whole rack of baby back are $47.50. Wow!!!!

author: Richard S.
review text: Absolutely loved this dish! The staff was great, and so was the service! This was definitely an amazing meal and I cannot wait to go back one day! It was truly a wonderful experience.

author: Laura G.
from: Horizons West / West Orlando, Winter Garden, FL
review text:
Bobby-Q has amazing reviews so I made a point to stop in for dinner. It was thirty minutes out of my way and after a long day of hiking. I really wanted to enjoy the BBQ.

I started out with Q-Rolls. It's a tortilla rolled up with smoked brisket and deep fried. It was delicious. The brisket was outstanding and the crispy tortilla was nice. I liked the brisket so much that I ordered tacos with brisket. Unfortunately the brisket on the tacos came out dry and unappealing. The pecan coleslaw was very good and the pecans on top added a nice twist on the overall flavor. I didn't care for the smoked ribs. They came out moist and the meat fell from the bone but it lacked a smoky flavor. It taste like it was boiled with sauce added to it.

I ordered a couple of their specialty drinks. The menu stated that they were made with premium liquor. When I asked the server about it I learned that it was not what I would consider premium. I never heard of the label before and she told me that an upgrade from the menu would be Smirnoff. I recommend asking what's in your drink when you order it.

author: Davidm A.
review text: I've been meaning to put this review but keep forgetting... guess that's how much of an impact Bobby's bbq left on me at the metro area. Took forever to get seated the food was super fatty and didn't really have any meat. The service was good. My wife could not even finish her meal. Place was way over packed I felt. The only reason why they get 3 stars from me is that there customer service was great. We had problems and the manager came out and helped us. Best customer service ever. Usually you have managers saying that you ate some the food we can't do much for you, but nope helped us out... plus my wife literally only took like 3 bites out of her plate.

author: Marissa S.
review text:
We made sure to squeeze in a BBQ meal before leaving Arizona. Since this made it to Yelp's Top 100 List, I knew we were going to be in for a treat.

Their beautiful covered patio made for a wonderful al fresco dining experience with heaters all around. Our server was warm and prompt with all of our needs. He started us off with their complimentary house cornbread, it was so delicious we devoured it in a heartbeat and requested for seconds.

Famous for their BBQ, we indulged ourselves with their Smoke House Baby Back Ribs and Brisket. They were both melt-in-your-mouth good bursting with the right amount of tanginess. Simply perfect. After having seen a photo of the Chicken Fried Chicken, we were sold and ordered it as well. Wow, juicy, tender, and oozing with flavor, the breaded chicken was fried until golden. And their uber creamy mashed potatoes? Stellar.

Sealing it on a sweet note, our server gifted us a bag of freshly made mini donuts dusted with cinnamon sugar for the road. They were awesome! Quite the service and experience, don't you think so?

Tip: Check-in on Yelp for 10% off. They also have Happy Hour deals you might not want to miss.

author: KJ J.
review text:
I normally do not want and rave about a place for weeks after, but this is one of the best BBQ joints I have been to and I travel all over the country.

Driving up it looked like I may be able to valet and I wondered if I was underdressed coming from a hike. The folks are very attentive and friendly and fortunately I made a reservation for 2 of it would have been a 20+ min wait on a weeknight.

The servers were on point and attentive. We ended up getting a couple of raspberry lemonades and the Hog Heaven ($65). Reading the reviews, I got the roasted chicken. It was the combination of chargrilled and BBQ.

One of the t-shirts they sell says "I live pig butts and I cannot lie" at $26 each.

They give you mini donuts on your way out.

author: Richard F.
review text:
BEST MAC N CHEESE - NO CAP! " cheesy, gooey, sticky, magical"

Upon arrival service was great we were seated quickly and were greeted by our server Adam. Adam was very helpful with recommendations and answering our questions. He was very well-informed and had great customer service.

The food was delicious and the meat is tender and juicy. I was surprised by how quickly our food arrived. They really put so much hard work and love into their meats! Their wings weren't the best I've had but they were also good and satisfactory.

Adam treated us with a complimentary Dessert which consisted of fluffy churro doughnuts with a strawberry glaze and whipped cream. This was the perfect way to end the night. I want to thank Adam for delivering exceptional service. Will I be back? Most definitely!!

Check in on Yelp for a discount off your bill.

author: Jiae K.
review text: Omgash!! Best BBQ ever! Came this restaurant while traveling Arizona from California. Made a reservation for brunch on a Christmas eve. Waitress was super nice explained the detailes of the menu. We had Smoked St. Louis Style Ribs Platter and Smoked Jumbo Texas Beef Ribs Platter and both of them were super yummy and delicious.  Will definitely come back here if I visit Arizona again! Best BBQ place you will never get wrong here

author: Peggy Q.
review text: OMG - the place was amazing - staff was great!! Keralynn was a treasure - great advice on food. Food spectacular!! Had the 18 hour smoked brisket sandwich with house made Barbecue sauce, mac-n-cheese (made with like 4 different cheeses and extremely creamy), and wedge side salad that had house made blue cheese dressing. I'm from Texas but this best barbecue I've ever had!!

author: Krista M.
review text: Soooooo good! Ordered the baby back ribs, beans and potato. I also ordered a side salad. They brought cornbread as an appetizer and donuts at the end. My husband ordered a surf and turf mix of steak and shrimp along with corn and Brussels sprouts.

author: Michael R.
review text:
So I'm a former multi-year Yelp elite that just got too busy to keep up with my reviews. That said, Bobby Q has temporarily brought me out of retirement like Floyd Mayweather looking for a quick payday. IMO, any review less than 5 stars for this place is strictly a matter of personal preference or some one-off issue unreflective of the mass experience.  I had:

3 meat combo w/ baby back ribs, brisket, and smoked sausage. Plus, corn bread, pecan coleslaw, Mac n Cheese, mashed potatoes, and Q Rolls.

I'm actually a relatively small-portion eater, but sitting outside the restaurant and smelling the blissful bbq aroma, while ordering, was like walking into a pre-COVID Costco on an empty stomach. I found myself wanting to sample everything and leaving with way more than I bargained for. Unlike Costco though, I didn't wake up the next day with a 'what the hell did I just do' hangover (I mean why does everything taste so good at Costco and crappy when I make it?) Getting back on track, I barely put a dent in my order and have now had my original dinner, a microwaved bbq breakfast, and I'm looking forward to lunch with the last of my leftovers.

Now, I've always considered myself more of a Tri Tip person, but... damn, Bobby Q's brisket was amazing. Basically, if bbq could be sold on a cotton candy stick, Bobby Q's tender, smoked brisket would be the top seller. The ribs were equally tender, and which one you prefer is likely a matter of preference, but there's really no point in me trying to convince you either way. Like a debate over the GOAT in basketball, the Kobe, Lebron, Jordan argument is never ending and there's really no wrong answer. Although, whichever one of three players above you like the least, that's the smoked sausage. It was good, don't get me wrong, but it's smoked sausage competing against brisket and baby backs, what can I say?

Regarding the sides:

Cornbread: Good, took it to go so I'm not sure what they offer in-restaurant but some honey butter would've taken it over the top.

Pecan coleslaw: Loved it. No idea why other places don't do this. If you like coleslaw, you'll be in heaven.

Mashed potatoes: Good, but the gravy made them great. I got the gravy on the side, and I'm not sure why, but when I opened it, it smelled like clam chowder to me. I thought I'd got a bonus item somehow. When I couldn't find the gravy, I circled back to my bonus chowder and realized my error. Regardless, it was bomb.

Mac n Cheese: Good. Generally par for the course. Although, I have known some places to blow it somehow. This is not one of those places.

Finally, the Q Rolls: (Insert four letter word here starting with the letter F and ending with u, c, k.) These egg roll looking things stuffed with tender brisket are a game changer. I mean, c'mon, dipped in a special bbq ranch sauce and a light crunch in every bite? It's stupid really. If heaven doesn't have this recipe, I'm choosing reincarnation if given the choice. You need to order these!

Final word: Try it or diet? The suspense is killing you right?

Definitely Try it! Then try it for breakfast the next day, and one more time for the hell of it. I'm in a hotel with a crappy microwave and it was actually just as good this morning, no lie. Your welcome. Now back to my retirement.

author: Aileen C.
review text:
Friendly and attentive service.  Cozy atmosphere on the patio.  Paired with good food on a warm sunny day = chef's kiss

We ordered wings and Cajun shrimp for appetizers. Both came out quickly and served warm.  For our meals, we ordered the chicken fried chicken with beer fries and the beef ribs with mashed potatoes.  Everything was tasty and we enjoyed sitting outside on the patio.  I hope to try their burgers next time we return.

author: William M.
review text:
A memorable experience! A great meal with a fun, inviting environment and super excellent service.

We went here while visiting Phoenix in March 2020, a couple of weeks before everything shut down.

Our start was the crispy Q-Rolls. We had the Whole Hog Heaven. The Baby Back Ribs and St. Louis Ribs as well as the brisket and sausage were all excellent. Our great sides were shoestring fries, cole slaw and beans.

We finished with the Sub-Zero Banana Cream Square which was very good.

The service was amazingly great. The atmosphere was fun and comfortable.

It's not the best BBQ I've had, but Bobby Q is one of those places where the entire experience goes above the sum of its parts.

Can't wait to go back!

author: Fer C.
review text:
We picked this joint because they accommodate big parties. We were a group of around 15 people and they set us up in a separate room with two dedicated servers. They obliged with less than an hour of notice. So five stars for service!
As for the food, it's a different story. Check out my picture: I count 4 pieces of grilled veggies, a mini bowl of beans, cornbread, and a couple fistfuls of pulled pork. Does that seem worth $23 to you?! I don't think so.
The value proposition is poor. Taste wise, it's not what you would expect for something costing this much. It's smokey and flavorful, but no better than what you get at Dickey's or any other southern bbq joint, where a platter like this will set you back $15 max.
Their beer on tap selection was excellent though. I think it would be a great place to have happy hour and an appetizer, but definitively not for an overpriced dinner.

author: Arturo M.
review text:
Came into town for spring training at Camel Back Ranch (Go Dodgers) and my co-worker told me I could not go to Phoenix without trying Bobby Q.

Well she was right! I'm never going back without visting this place. The service was great and the BBQ was excellent... especially the brisket and sides.

The decor reminded me a bit of Lucille's back home in SoCal, but the food was ten times more delicious.

author: Alexandraiah B.
review text: The customer service here is 5 stars! Our server Adam is the best server we have been placed with anywhere in a long time. He did a great job of recommending and bringing us additional condiments and items that he enjoyed to give us the best experience. The French dip was amazing. My brisket in my potato was a little dry, but the broccolini and everything else including the donuts was amazing!

author: Lenny D.
review text:
Very disappointed. This is not good BBQ.
Ordered the 2 meat plate- brisket and sausage. It came out with bbq sauce drizzled on top of it. This is a sign of bad BBQ. good BBQ doesn't need sauce, let alone the restaurant making that decision for you.
The "sliced" brisket was falling part with no flavor or bark.
The sausage was bland. No smoke flavor. Not sure it was even smoked.
Can't believe people think this is good BBQ.

author: Katie Z.
review text: This was a great spot on our way back to Phoenix from Gand canyon. The food and service was great! I also enjoyed the free cornbread appetizer they brought out while waiting for our meal and the server was very friendly and told us things to do around Phoenix since we were visiting. The portions were large and the Mac and cheese was nice an cheesy and piping hot. The restaurant was huge and included outdoor seating and a separate lounge. Definitely make a stop here if you're passing through.

author: Shayla B.
review text:
***4.5 Stars***

It's true. This place is all that and a bag of chips! All that and a plate of fall off the bone baby back ribs! All that and a box of freshly baked donuts! All that and... okay you catch my drift. It's truly all THAT!

Read some of the glowing reviews about Bobby Q before my recent trip to Phoenix and I just HAD to come here during my visit. Let's just say that they definitely impressed in all departments. Starting off with the decor and ambience; absolutely stunning! This place is pretty large inside too.

They have a gorgeous covered patio with really pretty lighting. There's even a TV on the patio for all of the sports heads. Speaking of that, their BAR is beautiful too. It's a wrap around style with plenty of TV's and lounge tables. The dining area is dark and spacious with a fabulous ambience and nice high ceilings. Just really well put together.

Service is absolutely impeccable! Derrick was truly amazing! That man deserves a raise! Talk about being on it the ENTIRE time. I was never forgotten and always attended to but not in an overwhelming way. He was also kind enough to give me some great recommendations as far as hiking and sight seeing in the area. A true gem with heart and personality.

The drinks are.... wowza! I had their Q-lada which was similar to a piña colada but with strawberry purée and damnit... It was phenomenal! It was almost too pretty to drink. It came garnished with fresh coconut and pineapple and came l served in a HUGE ass glass! Shoutout to the bartender who hooked this drink up because it was FABULOUS! Yes, I was feelin' it.

And last but not least.... that FOOD!!! Woooooo babyyyy! Those RIBS were the truth! The TRUTH. Period. I ordered their 1/2 rack of baby back ribs w/ mac and cheese and ranch beans. It was delicious!!! The ribs definitely stole the show. They were falling off the bone and were oh so tender. The bbq sauce was a hit! Those PORTIONS are no joke either! Literally had to take a picture of my leftover boxes because it looked like I hadn't even eaten anything but I DID! I got so full. Mmm.

The mac and cheese was so creamy and cheesy but just a little too rich for my taste. They got the flavor down wonderfully though. The ranch beans were pretty good too but could have definitely used more seasoning on them. This meal also comes with cornbread AND they give you freshly baked homemade donuts at the end of your meal too. Lawdy lawd laaawd! I was NOT ready.

Ermahgaaawd that cornbread! Yaaaass! It was a hit! And those donuts? And even BIGGER hit! That cornbread was so moist and the butter melted as soon as I spread it on the top. It was melting in my mouth! So good! Derrick even gave me some more to-go! Ha! Like I REALLY needed it, but it was so damn delicious.

I can't even talk about the donuts now because now I'm craving. They were perfect. That cinnamon sugar coating, that fluffy center... mm mm mmm. What a nice surprise! Even though I was stuffed to the MAX, I still was able to enjoy one before having to call it quits and taking them to go. What a night, what an experience, what a MEAL. It was fabulous. The owner/manager even stopped by to check-in and introduce himself while I was there.

This place really prides themselves on excellent service and I truly appreciate it. Oh yeah, I can't forget to mention the 10% off Yelp-in offer! It's really such a great deal to take advantage. This was the best meal that I had in Phoenix. Hell, it was the best meal that I had in Arizona period. Cannot wait to reunite with Bobby Q's one day! Maybe they'll bring a location to Cali one day (wink wink)? Who knows! I guess we'll just have to wait and see!

author: Isaiah G.
review text: We found this place on yelp. You can see it off the freeway. The parking lot is really big. This place is legit from the outside. There was no wait so we were seated right away. The decor here is beautiful. They had tv's all over do we got to watch a game. I wish I would have got the servers name but I forgot. The service he gave us was phenomenal. We got the food and portions are large and the food is delicious here. The strawberry lemonade was so good. Everything about this place is a  star will definitely recommend this place to friends a family.

author: Sheller K.
review text:
I grew up in Minnesota, and prior to me moving to a more southern state, the only barbecue I had was famous Dave's (which I am not a fan of). This place is on par with Famous Dave's. So on track to sub par.

I ordered delivery through Grubhub. I asked for the BBQ sauce on the side, yet it was coated with sauce. I also asked for a spicy sauce, and received a sweet sauce. I haven't physically been to this place so not sure what the BBQ sauce options are, but they could have at least put the sickly sweet diabetic making sauce on the side like I asked. At least Famous Dave's has a spicy sauce option.

The meat would have been good if it wasn't slathered in a sauce I didn't like. And I am a regular grubhubber, so I know the restaurant can view the ordering comments.

Also, the man n cheese was really dry.

And maybe my review is a little harsh, since I am used to the delicious BBQ of KC.

Not sure if I would be willing to give this place another try.

author: Suzie L.
review text:
BBQ
This is a great (but noisy) spot for dinner and it was in a convenient location - just a short walk from our hotel in North Phoenix.  My husband and I ordered a 3 meat combination BBQ platter (smoked beef brisket, St Louis ribs and pulled pork) to share.  It came with cornbread and a couple of sides (broccolini and coleslaw).  The cornbread and sides were tasty and the meat was cooked to perfection.  The portion was so generous that we couldn't finish it.  The service was excellent and the prices were reasonable.  The free fresh mini doughnuts that came with our bill at the end of the meal were frighteningly delicious!

author: Bryan K.
review text: Bobby Q's is a 5 out of 5, however; during our visit a fatal mistake was made. We ordered the Whole Hog Heaven and we received the meat but no sides. We informed 3 different servers (none of which was ours) and we still did not get the problem rectified until we were ready for the checks. Once the problem was made known the sides quickly came out and we got a dessert comped. The manager was very quick to apologize and try her best to rectify the issue. The ribs and brisket here are amazing and tender. The donuts and q-rolls are great as well. Mud pie is good but nothing special by any means. Bobby Q is an excellent BBQ restaurant in the PHX area. We will be back next time and hopefully we can enjoy our mac n cheese with our entrees!

author: Ernest C.
review text: Bobby Qs food is always good. The consistency is there with dine in or take out. Today I did take out. There was a wait but that was to be expected. The take out door is in the back of the building.

author: Norm W.
review text:
Consistent quality and service at BobbyQ. Did not see the roasted brussel sprouts on the menu but plenty of other options. Shared the Whole Hog with Nephew and Son had the Smokehouse Burger. Lunch menu on weekdays is cheaper but still reasonable if looking for a great weekend meal.

The Whole Hog if a lot of food. Choice of two half slabs of pork ribs, two additional meats and three sides. Corn muffins and doughnuts served with the meal. More than enough for a shared meal. Put this one on your list. Yelp check in earns 10 percent off your bill.

author: Lisa L.
review text:
Bobby Q's....what great bbq... My husband and I were in Austin specifically for bbq and this place did not disappoint.  We arrived there in the middle of the day, so no wait at all.  We were helped right away.

The bbq here was amazing. It was sauced perfectly and the sides of coleslaw and beans were so good.  the staff was friendly and helped us right away.

We'll definitely be back.

author: Maria M.
review text:
Very pricey, but worth it! The food was AMAZING! At the end instead of a chocolate mint or mints they give you a little bag with cinnamon donuts! Yes, donuts!

We began with drinks at the bar and then sat for dinner at a booth. We had Q-rolls for an appetizer and it is their version of spring rolls with bbq brisket and their dipping sauce is tasty. We ordered the bbq chicken with top serloin steak and Mac-and- cheese as the side and fries. We had corn bread and everything was delicious.

I strongly recommend this place if you love bbq sauce.

author: Jeff C.
review text: Was kinda of nervous to go during this Covid19 but I really like it, food was great as always and even like the paper menus. Ms Summer the waitress answer of our questions and again I felt safe going with the tables being space out.. 2 thumbs up!!

author: Eva S.
review text:
Celebrated Father's Day here. Menus are viewed on your own phone by scanning a QR code and social distancing is practiced.

Food was great, especially the baby back ribs and corn bread. The portions of meat are very generous! So bummed I forgot to use my 10% off check-in offer though.

The warm cinnamon sugar donuts are so good and even though we were stuffed, we still polished them off!

author: Jessica S.
review text:
As far as the BBQ goes, it was very ordinary, but they had some proper platter deals and lunch specials. Plus complimentary corn bread to start off the meal! They also usually have complimentary mini doughnuts to end the meal, but unfortunately the fryer wasn't turned on before opening when we arrived and it wasn't hot enough by the time we were ready to leave... so the fact that I had declined the second helping of corn bread (which came with our platter) all so I could save room for the doughnuts was not well planned out.

In any case, again... the BBQ was rather run-of-the-mill and perhaps some items were overcooked, but they're all about their sauce here. We ordered the *Platter Sampler* since it was a great way to try out their wares. We selected brisket, baby back ribs, and St. Louis style ribs for our meat choices and a mac as our side. Our server asked if we wanted their Original or Spicy BBQ sauces and she obliged when we requested for both. They give you relatively large vats of this sauce, so you basically are smothering everything in it. Otherwise, the baby back ribs were probably the most impressive. Good tender meat with that overcooked, fall-off-the-bone quality. The sauce on the St. Louis ribs wasn't anything I was accustomed too; a bit astringent and not exactly vinegary. The brisket was pretty boring, dry, and over cooked. Again, the sauce helped greatly to enhance its quality.

We also sampled a bit of their lunch special for $9.95, the *BLC Sandwich* aka the bacon, lettuce, and CHICKEN. It was a very good deal and the one half we consumed was actually rather tasty; meaty and juicy chicken with a large helping of bacon, lettuce, and sauce.

Service was fantastic and the outdoor patio was relaxing and comfortable with the cushions, although said cushioning was kind of grody and caked with spilled food. There's a lot of BBQ in Phoenix and this one is very much well-loved by the locals. Again, not real BBQ in my opinion, but you go for the ambiance... and good deals!

author: Natasha K.
review text:
Man I really wanted to give this place 5 stars... The food was incredible but the service was actually left me unsatisfied.

Found this place on a whim, I was stuck in the area and starving and saw the great reviews here so decided to give it a try. The place wasn't too busy on a Thursday night but I stood at the front podium for what felt like 3-4 minutes with waiters, hosts, bartenders buzzing around me doing things, chatting with each other and not even noticing I was standing there waiting. They finally sat me but then I waited another 9 minutes (this time I kept my eye on my watch) to get greeted and brought a menu. I was dining on my own as I travel for work and have noticed that when you are a table of one, you get kind of forgotten about.

I ordered the Q rolls, which, oh my god, GET THE Q ROLLS!!!! So tender and juicy and the dipping sauces are great. I also got the ribeye which was delicious as well. The cornbread was one of the best cornbread I have ever had. I even got to take home two little complimentary donuts.

This place has ALL of the right ingredients to be a favorite but I just wish service was a bit more attentive. However, I would definitely visit back next time I am in Phoenix.

author: Kristen M.
review text:
Where do I start?!?

Made reservations for 5:45pm and arrived right on time and was seated promptly right at the side by side tables in front of the bar.  It wasn't too busy but there were plenty of patrons in the restaurant.

Jared was our server and he was LEGIT!! We were welcomed by him and asked if we had ever been to a Bobby Q's to which the answer was no. He gave a quick background about the restaurant chain and how it came about. Advised their angus steaks are aged 60 days and cut in-house and their BBQ meats are smoked for 22hrs (Pretty sure those were the timeframes but I could be wrong). Went over the menu and gave the drink menu.

Started out with the Cajun Shrimp appetizer
-shrimp not over cooked
-sautéed in butter cajun seasoning and beer
-garlic bread
Holy crap this was soooo good!! The shrimp was "juicy" which is not something I would ever describe shrimp as but I'm not quite sure how else to describe it. It was DELICIOUS and not tough or chewy. I'm a sauce fanatic and I literally wanted to drink the sauce out of the dish but didn't think that was appropriate so I opted to just dip the garlic bread in the sauce

The cornbread was dense and sweet and didn't fall apart - yummmmy

Dinner came out within 10 min, right after the shrimp was finished. I got the pick 2 meats as suggested by Jared because I couldn't decide between the beef brisket or the pulled pork - and with the pick 2 I got both!!  The pulled pork was my FAVORITE of the 2. It was fall off the fork tender and melted in my mouth. Again since I'm a sucker for good sauce I asked for more BBQ sauce to which Jared brought out both spicy and regular. The spicy wasn't too spicy at all and had just the perfect amount of "spice", that was my favorite of the two BBQ sauces.  I dipped my potato in the bbq sauce and even my mac and cheese it was so good I could drink it!

For my sides I had the loaded baked potato without chives and the mac and cheese.
Baked Potato - The skin was baked with salt which is my fav!!
I asked for a side of butter since it came with just sour cream, bacon bits and shredded cheese. It was good but just a standard baked tater and since I seem to love extra condiments I personally could have went for more sour cream and cheese but I'm not going to complain. My friend had the ranch baked beans and next time those are what I will get in place of the baked potato.

Mac n cheese -creamy and thick. Rich in flavor but not too rich - I loved it and will def order again

Let me tell you how much I loved the music!! It included 80's pop Deniece Williams-Let's hear it for the boy, Motown; The Supremes, 80's rock; Loverboy-Turn me loose, Katrina and the Waves-Walkin on sunshine, Dusty Springfield-Son of a Preacher Man, Wild Child-Play that funky music white boy, Evelyn King-love come down, Queen and the list of awesome music goes on and on!!

Had a perfect front row view of the 76ers vs Rockets game and all.

Christy, one of the managers came to check on us about halfway through dinner to make sure everything was great and make sure everything was acceptable

Lots of drink choices and I couldn't choose just 1, so I got 3 :-)

Watermelon cooler with tajín rim - Strong but delicious

Q-lada -Toasted coconut rim with some type of coconut cream and Pieces of strawberries blended
Cannot taste any alcohol in it with the light rum and it was super delicious and refreshing

Pineapple Passion - Served in a frozen pineapple with a dried pineapple slice and tangerine slice
Creamy and strong but delicious - similar to a pina colada

Between the busser(s) and Jared, the empty plates were cleared promptly

Dessert, I was so full from shoveling all the delicious eats in my face but, I couldn't pass up their dessert!!  I got the banana sub zero square with warm caramel drizzle.  It's frozen banana pudding with a graham cracker walnut cinnamon bottom crust (I think that's what the crust was, that's what it tastes like). It was also very good but I could only eat a few bites and opted for a to go box to enjoy later.

Christy came by after we finished dessert to see how everything was and even got my dessert to go box!

Never felt rushed at any point throughout dinner/drinks/dessert.

I didn't want to leave and felt like I could hangout here all night!! But, after 2 hours I figured I better get my a$$ up so other people can enjoy this place just as much as I did!!

Just when you think it cannot get any better, our check showed up with a bag of FRESH, HOT donuts fried in peanut oil and covered in cinnamon sugar!!  OMG! I couldn't wait to eat them later even though I had ZERO space for anything else. I had to eat just 1 while it was hot and it literally MELTED in my mouth.

Bobby Q's, you have a fan in me!! I loved every single aspect of my experience and anytime I'm back in Phoenix I WILL BE BACK!!

author: Anne C.
review text:
Went here while in town not too long ago... came on a weekend for lunch around 12:30pm. It was lively, but not too busy. However, by the time we left there was a line of customers waiting to be seated.

From beginning to end, the service was great.. our drinks were always kept filled, we were checked on routinely, and our orders were ready in a timely manner..

Omg the food is soooo good. We opted for their feast type meal... we got baby back ribs, chicken, and brisket with Mac&cheese, coleslaw, and corn.. we also got broccolini and of course their cornbread....

The cornbread was a bit crumbly, but otherwise super warm and moist.. so delicious with butter and a little bit of honey. The sides were all flavorful and still simple, which I love.. the brisket was juicy and so tender you can cut it easily with a fork.. the baby back ribs fell off the bone.. and the chicken was delicious but definitely not the star..

For dessert, we shared a mud pie which would satisfy any chocolate/cookie lover.. and to top things off, our bill came with a small bag of fresh made mini donuts.. mind blown.

My family and I really enjoyed our experience here and wish I didn't live so far!

author: Sierra V.
review text: This has become a favorite in our household. My mom brings her new clients here, thEy have yet to disappoint  The baby back ribs are awesome as well as the prime rib, I get mine cooked medium with au jus only and it's delectable. They have this spicy bbq sauce that is served hot and in a little thermos, it's so great to have that at the table for everyone. Complimentary cornbread before your meal and complimentary DONUTS at the end. What could be better?! Not much that's a fact

author: Thelma H.
review text:
We read some reviews on yelp and decided to give it a try. So glad we did! I have to say my husband is one picky rib eater and by far this place it now his favorite...coast to coast!! We're visiting for only a week...and he has to go back one more time for more ribs.
Tender, fall off the bone but crispy outside with an amazing sauce but not overpowering. Side dishes you'd expect but all extremely tasty. Roasted corn was tasty as were the little fresh donuts they make right there covered with a cinnamon sugar mixture...great ending to a wonderful meal! Give it a try..you won't be dissapointed.

author: Melissa M.
review text: Come here every time I visit AZ. I've never been disappointed and have tried several menu items. Love it!!

author: Luisa H.
review text:
WOW!
5 stars for Trey alone-- dude was answering phones, bartending, and taking on tables ALL with incredible service!!! He helped us navigate their massive offerings of food and alcohol: I loved my Lavender Sour: it was smooth, not too sweet and garnished with a beautiful edible flower. I shared a giant platter called the whole hog and it was a life changing experience! Which is the best way to describe this place, an experience for the senses. From the wafting bbq smell greeting you in the parking lot to the helpful staff upon entering to the great atmosphere and the fabulous fare. Take someone special to enjoy with, there is plenty to share!

author: Chaz D.
review text:
Bobby Q has been a part of the neighborhood ever since I was a kid. Before my last visit, it had been a solid 10 years since my last time. I wasn't sure what to expect as I didn't remember any of it. I was excited to see how good the BBQ was and to support a local place.

FOOD: We ordered the "Whole Hog" which comes with 2 types of ribs (your choice), 2 types of meat (your choice), and 3 sides (your choice). This sampler platter was $55, but a great trial for three people. The food only took about 15 minutes to be prepared and brought to our table. Holy cow it was a great feast! My personal favorite from that meal was the St. Louis Ribs. Those ribs were cooked to perfection and fell off the bone with amazing flavor. The sausage was also extremely delicious with a hint of spice. The sides we chose were mac & cheese, baked beans, and roasted corn. All of these were exceptional and well worth it. The food alone will have me coming back to try other menu options.

SERVICE: Our server was Dustin. He was a really nice guy who knew a lot about the menu and how all this great food is prepared. One of the people in my group had a dairy allergy, and Dustin was able to help accommodate us on what we could order. I was really impressed with the service and how friendly everyone was.

OVERALL: Bobby Q shocked me with their delicious food and exceptional service. The ambiance of this restaurant makes you feel right at home with a southern BBQ style vibe, and food that is to die for. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in the valley who is looking for a great BBQ place to try.

author: Nick S.
review text:
Unreal. This place is no question some of the absolute best BBQ I have had in my life. I'm from Texas, and have had plenty of some of the best Texas has to offer, and this was right up there. A co-worker and I split the BBQ tray,, and every item blew us away. Q- rolls were legendary, the St. Louis ribs were moist and delicious, the baby back ribs fell off the bone, the chicken was juicy, the brisket was melt in your mouth good, cornbread incredible, and the sides to die for. They also have a pretty extensive and diverse drink menu if that's your thing.

I would recommend this place to literally anyone, doesn't matter if you're from the area or out of town, I cannot stress enough how good this place was. The ambiance adds a bit to the experience, and the dining area was full the entire time we were there

author: Tim N.
review text:
Back again. Tonight I had the country fried chicken stEak. It was great.  Mus

1st time here. Recommended by a friend.  This place is awesome. Great atmosphere & service is good.  Food is amazing. The orange blossom beer is great. Complimentary corn bread and butter cones out hot.  Q-rolls -  brisket stuffed egg rolls are amazing. For the entree I ordered the 2 meat combo with sausage and pulled pork. Baked potato loaded and ranch beans on the side.  Delicious!   The food is outstanding here.   5 stars. If your in Phoenix you have to st

Back again

author: Jessica J.
review text:
****Check-in to receive 10% off your meal****

Came across this place when we were heading to the airport later that day.

Our server suggested The Whole Hog Heaven for $51. It can definitely feed 4 people. The portions are pretty big. We had a hard time eating the chicken and all the side dishes because were were super full.

For the sides, I suggest the Mac N Cheese. The Horsestring Fries and the vegetables were not good. The fries were super salty. We had to ask them to remake it, but it took so long after we finished our meats that we just told them to forget about bringing it out. The vegetables were unflavored and not good.

The ribs and the brisket were BOMB! The ribs were so tender and breaks off so easily!! Super delicious!! I would pass on the chicken and order something else.

Service and management were super friendly. I liked how the server told us background of what this restaurant is and how long they cook their meats. He said they cook it 16 hours. (but if forgot which meat or is it all?? I'm not sure).

author: J S.
review text:
When the pickle on your plate is the best thing, you know it's not great.

Not sure if it was just an off day but we were salivating when we read the Yelp reviews - "best Mac and cheese" and "best bbq." We did not find these remarks true.

We ordered the pulled pork and the beef brisket a side of corn and Mac and cheese. The meat was extremely dry. It was passable if you drenched it in bbq sauce. Same went for the pulled pork (was slightly tender but not much). The corn was flavorless. It was not served on the cob which I had asked prior to but they told me it was shaved off so I was expecting it to be grilled and then cut. It was like eating corn out of the can. Very watery. The Mac and cheese was alright. Very cheesy for sure but definitely not the "best in Phoenix."

Server was super sweet but it's a pet peeve when they come to the table with dirty dishes. COVID-19 precautions seemed to be followed though which a plus. The tables were spaced out and everyone wore masks. The space was cool the outdoor atmosphere was great.

Overall, it was okay. Nothing to write home about. Would prefer a small, mom and pop BBQ joint. Again, maybe it was an off day.

Staff was friendly. They gave free donuts at the end and they split our sandwiches for us in the back so we could share.

author: Dolores D.
review text:
Came here for the first time. Heard great reviews. Never new there was a restaurant here. It's like hidden, lots of trees next to it. You park in the back of the restaurant.

Sign up for the club member to get emails and your first email you get $10 off.
Check in on yelp you get 10% off.

I got the filet mignon it comes with 2 sides I got mash potatoes & garden veggies. It was delicious.

Also we got the whole hog heaven. Comes with 2 rib choices, 2 meats, & 3 sides. We we got the baby back ribs & St. Louis ribs. They are both good the only difference is the St. Louis ribs taste more smokey. The meats we got both chicken rotisserie. The sides we got were mash potatoes, garden vegetables & fries. There were a lot of fries. The veggies were huge. The meats, were good & ribs.

After you order your food they bring you corn bread with butter. It's delicious and sweet. Also after your meal they bring you complementary donuts they tasted like cinnamon to me but for my more they tasted like lemons.

author: Travis T.
review text:
A couple of facts about me:

I'm a native of AZ. I've only been to the Grand Canyon a few times. This was my first visit to Bobby Q.

I can't believe it took me so long. I have sampled their BBQ at events, but this is my first visit to their establishment. So being a native, I grew up going to Bobby McGee's (one of owner Bob Sikora's original endeavors here in the Valley). In 2005, he turned his attention to BBQ and opened up Bobby Q. You can smell the meat smoking as you get out of your car in the parking lot. The menu has a variety of meats to choose from like tender brisket, pulled pork, chicken, prime rib, steaks, fish and burgers. The brisket and pork is slow cooked for hours at a low temperature. They smoke their meat with Almond and Mesquite wood and use a nice blend of spices for the dry rub. For BBQ sauce, Bobby Q has both a sweet and spicy Carolina sauce available. They have a variety of sides to choose from for your entree but I highly recommend their cheesy mac & cheese. It's so gooey and delicious! My sliced-brisket sandwich was amazing and I savored each bite. If you aren't a meat lover (why would you come here if not?), the Biltmore location has a some vegan dishes and other healthy options on the menu. Bobby Q is known for their famous corn bread that is complimentary if you order something. They are really good (especially with butter on it) and are made fresh daily. Each table also gets a complimentary bag of fresh-made mini doughnuts dipped in cinnamon sugar for the ride home (mine didn't make it to the car). Overall, prices are very reasonable and portions are large. This was a fun experience and I look forward to future visits. The restaurant can be a little loud at times but it does have a fun community feel to it. In addition to the Biltmore location, Bobby Q also has a location in Mesa.

author: Mary T.
review text:
I was honestly pretty hesitant on coming to Bobby Q for dinner because I had only heard of it being a night club. So when my cousin chose this spot for her birthday dinner I was a little bit skeptical. To my surprise it was a very nice casual dining setting and the food wasn't half bad!

I ordered their 2 meat plate option that comes with 2 sides. I picked their rotisserie chicken and beef brisket along with Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. Everything was delicious! I even had some leftovers to take home.

Afterwards we were given a bag of doughnuts!

I can see myself coming back!

author: Meeks C.
review text: This place is always amazing every time me and my fiancé and family visit . Me and my fiancé like to come here a lot because the food is always so good and the donuts they give you at the end are just mouth watering . I recommend getting their Q-Rolls because they're just the best lol! They have a great selection when it comes to their menu and they have just the perfect servings when it comes to sharing ! Keep up the amazing work Bobby Qs ! I'll visit you soon

author: Lisa L.
review text: This bbq gem is very unassuming from the outside. We pulled into the back parking lot and I was really not expecting much. We go in and not only is it a decorated super cute we were greeted right away and the place was beyond busy. I ordered the Wednesday special. Truth be told I would get it every Wednesday if I could! Our server brought us corn bread which was so good and after our meal she gave us a small bag of mini cinnamon and sugar donuts which were obviously freshly made.

author: CheRich R.
review text: Great food great service! We made Father's Day reservations and this place did not disappoint just like the first time we came!!! Delicious food well seasoned tender meat! Fresh cornbread... even the water was fresh we added lemon and cucumber. The brisket was moist and tender like I love it! My husband was in food heaven. That is a great compliment being he's a country boy! The Mac and cheese was cheesy and the corn was sweet and buttery... Everything was delicious and well prepared! Thank you for excellence! And the military discount 5Stars!

author: Lorraine F.
review text:
This place has amazing reviews so we finally decided to try this out and yes, it is definitely worth the Yelp hype. We were seated in the outdoor patio, perfect for the weather that night. The customer service was great and I have no complaints.

Our meal started with complimentary cornbread. I'm not sure if I was just too hungry or what, but that has gotta be the best cornbread I've ever had in my life. And I don't even like cornbread. For my entree, I got the Southern Fried Chicken with a side of mashed potatoes and mac & cheese. Yuuuum.

I will definitely be back here to try something that's actually barbecue. The prices are a bit high, but once in a while, I think this place is worth it.

author: Megan J.
review text:
