I came here for dinner with my family the other night and we had a nice time. I would definitely recommend making a reservation because they get SO busy especially on weekend nights.

It is for sure likely going to be crowded and on the loud side, but it is a super fun environment. The restaurant is really big and it has a great Western theme.

We were seated pretty quickly with our reservation. It definitely took awhile for us to be greeted and to get our first round of drinks. Our server mentioned that the bartender was really behind so that it might take awhile for our drinks. I felt bad for the bartender and it seemed like they should have had another bartender helping. They had also run out of many of their gins because it was the end of the month, but I felt like that shouldn't be an issue. However, their cocktails were tasty.

Regardless, our server was super nice and friendly. She was very good and attentive in the beginning and then towards the end it was difficult to track her down for awhile. I think she had a really big party that she was taking care of.

For starters, we started off with the recommended Q-rolls stuffed with brisket and served with chipotle sauce. These were delicious! They were crispy, not oily, and the brisket inside was tender and flavorful.

For my entree, I got the fried chicken, with a baked potato and mac n'cheese. The fried chicken was very good--crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. The baked potato was good--not overly oily. The mac n' cheese was very good too, but reminded me a lot of stouffer's mac n' cheese, which isn't a bad thing--just reminded me of it. The prime rib that I tasted was also very good--tender and flavorful.

The prices were fair.

Overall, really fun and casual ambience, good food, fair prices and decent service.

author: Lyrissa R.
review text:
There's a damn good reason this place is close to 5 stars with over 3,000 reviews.

Complimentary cornbread and donuts, impeccable service, moist and tender meats, mouthwatering sides....what other reasons do you need to try this place?

Came here during lunch on a Monday with about 1/3 of the restaurant full.

Erica, our server, was so wonderful and a great addition to the already hospitable weekend we were having.

Checked out the lunch menu and they definitely offered great value meals. Boyfriend and I were looking at the 1/3 rack of ribs, but decided to split the whole rack of ribs with 2 sides, mac & cheese and shoestring fries. Erica recommended the mac & cheese and we couldn't have been any happier. With fives cheeses, it was so cheesy and creamy.

Ribs were moist and fall-off-the-bone tender. They offered 3 types of made in house bbq sauce: regular, spicy and a vinegar based sauce. I liked mixing the spicy with the vinegar based. The added pepper to their shoestring fries made them great on their own. But since I love condiments, I dipped my fries in ranch and the bbq sauces because why not.

I wish I was hungrier so I could have ordered off the dessert menu. But then all of a sudden a bag of complimentary cinnamon sugar donuts appeared on our table courtesy of Erica and all of a sudden, I had room for donuts. They were made fresh when we got them and they were crunchy and sweet and so satisfying for the end of the meal. I took the rest to go and had them throughout the day.

I was out here for a Muay Thai competition and if we're planning do this tournament again, Bobby Q is a definite MUST for post fights.

author: Lillian F.
review text:
Coming from Virginia, I have some pretty strong opinions on what good barbecue is. For the most part, I've avoided barbecue since moving to Arizona, but my friends wanted to try out Bobby Qs, so trying out Bobby Qs we did.

We sat on the outdoor patio which was warmly lit and welcoming. Our server was incredibly friendly, which only added to the good vibes. Although not barbecue, the southern fried chicken caught my eye. I got it with creamy mashed potatoes and a delightful (maybe yogurty?) mac and cheese on the side. The cornbread that came with it was also heavenly. Though they are round and slightly more difficult to handle than the regular square ones, they were delicious and moist and there was more than enough butter that came with them.

My s/o got the pulled pork platter with roasted corn and shoestring fries. We traded our mashed potatoes and roasted corn because I absolutely ADORED the roasted corn. Perfectly buttery with such a good roasted flavor. Just thinking about it makes me hungry.

The only gripe I had was that for its price, there really wasn't that much food. It was enough for me to have leftovers, but it can't compare to my favorite bbq joint back home where $11 got you a pound of pulled pork.

author: Katherine P.
review text: First of all, although we were a very large party I still expect good service and we did not receive it.   We had a reservation so they should have planned for the number of servers needed.    Started off with very slow and inconsistent drink orders.    Cocktails were served in waves and not even in the order ordered, incorrect cocktails brought to the table.   Not a good start to dinner.    I thought I was settled on the brisket since the reviews raved about it.  Decided to try the prime rib instead and just taste the brisket off someone's plate.  After waiting about 45 minutes for our order, half of the table was completely finished with dinner by the time the other half received their food.   Both the prime rib and the brisket were both rather disappointing.     The best thing served was the free corn bread.

author: James J.
review text:
From the moment we sat down, I knew this was about to be an experience I couldn't wait to talk about...in a good way!  Alyssa is THE MAN!!! (I reiterated this over and over during our meal and she agreed so I'm cool lol)

Ok starting off with the fact that they squeeze the fruit juice fresh every day is enough to end it with too, so when you order your drink...somebody literally put some "elbow grease" into it, so don't skimp on the tip is what I'm suggesting.

The Q-Rolls are the best!!!! I honestly didn't get past those on the menu, lol.  Had 2 orders, can't wait to get back to Phoenix to try the full menu.  Oh, and they have their own Private Label Woodford Reserve too!

author: Vy T.
review text:
What a clever name!!

The restaurant is quite large but we made reservations to be safe. We got seated right away, and ordered the hog heaven to split between 3 ppl. We ordered the baby back and st.louis ribs with brisket, pecan cole slaw, mac and cheese and corn. They started off the meal with their complimentary corn bread, which was pretty good! Their brisket and ribs were tender and you didn't need a knife because it fell off the bone. We asked for their spicy BBQ sauce but I wish it was spicier. For their sides, I really enjoyed their mac and cheese and corn, which I recommend. Their cole slaw was just okay. The portion was perfect for 3 people and we even had some left overs.

To finish off the meal, they bring you fresh mini donuts that they fry and shake with cinnamon sugar. Such a sweet treat!

author: Desiree B.
review text: The food was amazing. Sat at the bar and ordered Qrolls, 8 oz sirloin, and my guy ordered the 10 oz prime rib. I am stuffed. Literally doing this as I start to drift off into a deep sleep lol. Didn't take pictures but service and food was perfect. Can't wait to try their happy hour

author: Rachel S.
review text: Too bad their quality changed lately. Ordered the stuffed baked potato to go. After arriving home to unwrap.. completely BURNT dried out small potato!!

author: Katie M.
review text:
I feel like I'm at a lost of words because of how amazing Bobby-Q is.
My husband and I tend to be picky with any place we eat. Tonight Monday night only about a 25min wait for seating anywhere. Pretty glad we got the outdoor seating.

Vince was our waiter tonight and wow above and beyond with customer service along with Chris who is a manager.
They must really strive on customer service because man it shows they are all on top of everything here.
Ok so where to start we started with the apps of the BBQ beef chimichanga things omg our kids couldn't stop eating them. As for main course my hubby got a half rack of ribs with potato salad and veggies(veggies not so great not even cooked all the way), I got the grilled shrimp in a Chimichurri sauce with Mac and cheese and roasted corn... all of it was amazing and I would order that again, as for my kids they got a pizza and it was very tasty they said.
Best part was the desert the little mini donuts
Soo yes I would come back my kids even said they will only eat BBQ from here!!!!

author: Anthony Nalli ..
review text:
I've got to say that Bobby Q has got some great, great food. Obviously the fall of the bone baby backs are a must, but so is the beef rib and especially the brisket. Of course the sausage was great too!

The mac and cheese side was the best I've ever had. It's no wonder it's their most popular item. It is the cheesiest and creamiest I've had and is absolutely addictive.

Speaking of addictive, the freshly made "Tiny Tom" (as I know them from back home) donuts covered in cinnamon are worse than drugs! :)

author: Siamrath B.
review text:
My little brother and I are on a long road trip from Los Angeles to New Orleans and we had to go past Phoenix. As I was driving my little brother searched up a place to eat and he wanted to try some barbeque.

We opted to try Bobby Q because another place was closed on Monday, and we thought the name + the numerous reviews was appealing.

We made a reservation online for 2pm but when we arrived, it wasn't packed so we were just able to get seated easily for 2. They also have an outdoor patio area where you can sit and enjoy a waterfall, we almost sat there but we decided to let the host sit us wherever was most convenient for them.

We were sat and asked what we wanted to drink by our waiter Chris(topher). He's got his greeting and mantra down, "Have you been here before?"
Us: No we're just passing by.
Chris: "Where are you all from?"
Us: Los Angeles area
Chris: "Very cool, I'm from California, San Bernardino myself!"

I heard this repeated to other customers who sat down. He's a very personable waiter.

We wanted to try a variety of things so my brother and I opted for the Whole Hog's Variety. It was about $54 but we already dented it. It came with a choice of a variety of different things but we chose: sausage, beef brisket, beef ribs, and St. Louis ribs.

Sausage: I thought it was good but nothing too special. Perhaps I'm just not a fan of sausages done this way, but by no means was it bad.

Beef brisket: This was probably the star of the dish. It was amazingly delicious. It was very juicy and tender and the sauce didn't overpower the meat taste. This is something I highly recommend.

Beef Ribs: I'm a sucker for beef ribs, and these were so good the meat came off the bones easily. The flavor was a little bland but that was perfect, because the sauce provided the needed salt.

St Louis Pork Ribs: They were also really good and they melted off their bones, but the St. Louis pork ribs were too salty. I was only able to eat 2 because I couldn't keep eating it, but the flavors were good.

For the sides we got the: Mac and cheese, corn, and pecan cole slaw.

I originally wanted more vegetables as a side because vegetables help compliment meat, but my little brother wanted the mac and cheese, and the corn. So I chose the cole slaw as a means to cut the richness of the different barbeque meats.

The mac and cheese was very rich, and I couldn't eat too much of it because of how rich both the entree and the side was.

I was also so-so with the corn, but as a disclaimer, I'm very impartial to corn to begin with. To me, unless it's naturally very sweet they're almost wasted calories. This was just a personal preference, but my brother wanted it.

The pecan cole slaw was perfect. If anything I would have liked a little more acidity in it, but it was such a good addition to the meal. After a bite of the rich pork ribs, the cole slaw really helps cleanse the palette. It was very refreshing.

Overall we were very pleased by this restaurant. Our bill came out to be about $39 per person (tax and a hefty tip) but we probably had enough food to last 3 meals.

author: Madeline S.
review text:
This restaurant was out of this world. I am no Phoenix local but my boyfriend is and as a place he grew up with, I was really excited to try this. I have a hard time finding reasonably priced BBQ where I live, so this was an impressive treat.

The Restaurant
Just wow. The design of this place feels like it should be on the cover of Home Magazine. It feels like a dream in both its indoor and outdoor seating. It's the kind of charming decor you just have to come to see for yourself.

The Service
These servers really know their menus that's for sure or at least ours did! Dustin was our waiter and he didn't need to question the menu. I have an allergy that is in just about everything and he didn't skip a beat knowing his ingredients which I greatly appreciate. He was friendly, upbeat and checked on us just enough. The food arrived quickly and the hot cornbread even quicker.

The Food
We ordered the Whole Hog to split between 3 people. We don't eat a ton of food but we definitely don't skimp out on portions when it comes to BBQ. The meal portion was plenty with some to spare. We chose the sausage which was super tender and packed with flavor and two different kinds of ribs that were to die for. I asked for some extra sauce and a toasted bun, and Dustin brought the bun with practically a pitcher of BBQ sauce (new best friend). The sides we ordered were the roasted corn, baked beans, and the mac n' cheese. I could only eat the beans which were fantastic, and the other two people loved their sides as well. The Whole Hog that comes with the three sides costs $52 and between 3 people that is more than reasonable!

Overall
I will most definitely be coming back here! I would love to try the outdoor seating next time because it's so beautiful and I know the food won't disappoint. I don't rave about restaurants often but I'll be spreading the word about this place to everyone I know who is looking for a fantastic BBQ restaurant. Thank you for a wonderful dinner!! My photos just don't do the food justice.

author: Karen W.
review text:
Review 5/10 for the 10 bookmarked businesses to review before the end of 2016! From Meagan B.'s thread: yelp.com/topic/phoenix-y…

Bobby Q's was on our way back from our weekend trip up north and it was around lunchtime so we figured we'd get something from there to go so we could eat it back at home. The menu was easy to browse through online. I called and placed an order for the three meat combo which would be ready in 15 minutes.

There are two areas in this restaurant. The front is for dining in while there is a separate back parking lot and take out entrance. Service at the counter was friendly and they even offered me a drink while my order was being put together.

The smell of BBQ in the car was mouth watering as we drove back home. I ordered the combo with baby back ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. For sides I had the roasted corn and coleslaw. The meal also included 2 pieces of cornbread and they gave me some extra BBQ sauce.

All the meats were very tender with smoky flavor. My favorite of the three was probably the pulled pork, followed by the baby back ribs. The brisket was good and they included fatty and lean pieces, but the memory of the superb brisket from Little Miss BBQ still lingers in my memory as one of the best I've had.

The sides were excellent. The roasted corn also had some smoked flavor and the coleslaw was crisp, tangy and refreshing.

Overall it was a good meal and I do like how they have more convenient hours and better atmosphere than Little Miss BBQ. I will be back for more BBQ!

author: Ray P.
review text:
Woo hoo! A solid five stars for some of the best BBQ I've had.  I've had my fair share of great BBQ experiences from all four corners of the US, including states and cities traditionally known for this great American dish.  I have to say that what I had at Bobby Q knocked it out of the park.

I had the two-meat combo comprising of baby backs and brisket.  According to my server, these two are "the ones that keeps the lights on" for the restaurant.  I totally see why.  Their meals are smoked in house for about a full day.  Combined with their special rubs, not only does this impart a great taste but the meats were some of the most tender and moist I've had.  The brisket was melt in your mouth tender while the pork ribs fell off the bone with little effort.  The BBQ sauce used was just right - not too overpowering the taste of the meat, not too sweet or "ketchupy".  Even the sides of broccolini and roasted brussel sprouts were spot on and complimented the entrees well..

I lucked out and came just before Happy Hour was done so I took advantage and ordered a couple of appys.  The buffalo cauliflower was exceptional (gotta try making this at home!) as was the beef brisket tacos.

I have to say that the service was great.  All of the staff, from the hostess, to my server, to the manager, Joanne, were friendly and helpful.

Easily one of the best for BBQ I've had.

author: Ramon F.
review text:
It's Monday afternoon and for some reason or another some restaurants close on Monday. So we just happen to be near Bobby Q and it was past lunch time, made a last minute decision eat here. Besides we haven't been here in a while. We didn't have to wait long to be seated since the lunch crowd was gone. We were seated by Arianna, our server and soon after we were seated she handed us our menu. Since it was not dinner yet and after lunch, I decided to go for a smaller meal. I went for the Sliced BBQ Prime Beef Brisket sandwich and I chose the baked potato as my side with all the fixings. As we were waiting for our orders cornbread was placed at our table with soft butter to spread in the cornbread. They were delicious to say the least. My dish was brought out and it was all I could do to stop focusing on my Brisket sandwich. Let me tell you I was not disappointed with my dish. Everything was cooked to perfection and by the time I was done I had eaten every morsel of goodness. I must of been hungry but, it was the way everything was prepared. I will return and try something different next time.
As a jester of advice, whenever you check in to Bobby Q or other restaurants that offer a discount on your check in, tell your server and show them, so that you are given the discount.

author: Dwayne O.
review text:
Ordered the Combination of Half a Slab of Baby Back Ribs and Catfish, along with Baked Potato,  Mac and Cheese and Roasted Corn. Quite a complete meal that we shared it among 2 people and still could not eat all of it. The Baby Back Ribs were super tender and moist and as a cut each rib, the meat would just fall off the bone. The Catfish was good, would have been nice with some tarter sauce. The sides were average, not great, but not bad. The baked potato was loaded with butter, sour cream, chives and Bacon so that was a winner, the mac and cheese was good but when the waitress said that is their recommendation and the best side, I expected a little more. The Roasted Corn when we ordered expected a ear of corn roasted over a grill, but what we received was an inch of 2 ends of corn on the cob and loose corn kernels in a small bowl which could have been corn from a can.

Salmon Dinner was a generous slab of fish and was well prepared. It was grilled and had a good crisp grilled skin which was very good and it came with 2 sides which my daughter choose the mac and cheese plus vegetables.

Cornbread is very good and the waiter was generous enough to give us another basket.

At the end if your meal, wait for the sugar donuts! Served warm they are killer!

Overall experience was very good with service and ability to park while restaurant was busy.

author: Michael M.
review text:
Let me start my review with one word and I'm not even sure if it's even a real word, WOW! There is no hype with the reviews here. They are all legit! The 2 meat platters are amazing, the appetizers rock, and the drinks were perfectly mixed.

Blake was our server and he was very attentive. The food came out fast, hot an delicious.

Jack, the general manage personally came out to check on us and to make sure we were 100% satisfied.

The four of us are all from New Jersey and this restaurant made the trip all the way to Phoenix Arizona worthwhile. Keep up the great work staff!

author: Jeanne B.
review text:
My girlfriend from Oregon and I had a delicious meal at Bobby Qs restaurant tonight. Initially, we had a minor situation with the menus each having different prices. The manager was very gracious and offered us the lower-priced menu.  Very professional and very friendly.
LeeAnne was our server and she was a 10.  ‼‼My girlfriend ordered a steak sandwich. The steak was grilled to perfection with a glazed caramelized sauce that brought out the steak's flavors. It was thick and juicy and so flavorful covered in grilled mushrooms served with onion rings so tasty I ordered one to go.
Their potato soup is almost a meal in itself. It is so flavorful with cheese and bacon and chopped onions and potatoes I could've eaten another bowl instead I got one to go.
Bobby Qs gives you a small bag of homemade donuts to thank you for enjoying their restaurant. Give it a try for sure.
Second review:  treated friends today to Bobby Qs for burgers and steak sandwiches. Kyle served us and he was beyond on top of keeping us satisfied. Actually I was the one who got treated today.  Manager Taylor himself took care of a minor problem I had with my steak. He solved the issue as fast as humanly possible.  He gave me the BEST customer service ever in any restaurant I've eaten. Food so wonderful; service the same.
Third review: my girlfriend took me to barbecue yesterday for my birthday. We wanted to go out in odd times so it would be so crowded and noisy. There are special was a prime rib sandwich with one of their yummy sides and by the time we got there it was sold out. We split a brisket and pork sandwich with a loaded potato and I have enough for dinner. The barbecue sauce is divine. My birthday dessert was a brownie and ice cream that I took to go because I was so full. This is one of my favorite restaurants in north Phoenix. I have never had a bad meal here

author: Benjamin C.
review text:
Three Meat Combo Platter: Brisket, Baby Backs, Chicken w/ Mac n Cheese & Straw Fries
Service: 10/10
Location: 10/10
Food: 11/10
The Q rolls as an appetizer will leave you speechless and the complimentary donuts for dessert will finish your meal perfectly.

Honestly the whole menu is fire.

author: Rashmi G.
review text:
When I saw quite a few of my Yelp friends checked in at Bobby Q, I definitely couldn't pass up a chance to go. We went on a Friday night and the wait for a table was about an hour and a half. This was a little bit longer than expected, however we figured we would grab a drink and wait. After seeing how large the drinks were that others around us had ordered, we decided on just one cocktail called Shipwrecked. It was large and pretty sweet with a blue raspberry-coconut flavor. Since this was the type of fruity drink I typically gravitate towards, I was satisfied and would get it again.

Their estimate on the wait time was fairly accurate so about an hour & a half later, we were seated at a table on their outside patio. Our waiter was friendly and came by our table immediately. He went over the menu items and suggested some of the meat plates and sides. I ended up getting a Pulled BBQ Chicken Sandwich with a side of Mac & Cheese (which multiple servers seemed to be recommending) and my fiancé got a three meat plate with the baked potato and mashed potatoes. While we waited, we were brought out some warm cornbread and butter to enjoy, and a short while later, our food arrived.

After tasting a little bit of everything that we got, I wish I would have ordered one of the red meats instead of the chicken sandwich only because it was so plain compared to the other items. I'm not a huge fan of red meat which I was pleased to see chicken on the menu, but the red meat had the actual BBQ flavor I was hoping to find. All the side items were good; I personally liked the mashed potatoes the most but my fiancé liked the mac and cheese the most. The chicken sandwich plate and side was small enough for one to finish entirely but we had some leftovers from the three meat plate.

After we were done with our meals, we were brought a small bag with some cinnamon sugar covered donuts. I had seen a couple of people making them fresh at the front of the restaurant when we walked in, so this was definitely a nice & unique treat.

Overall, I would definitely be up for coming back here and giving some of the other menu items a try ... 4.5 stars, just not quite 5.

author: Nichole M.
review text:
Since we loved Bobby Q in Mesa, we decided to see what the "Original" location in Phoenix had to offer. I don't know who runs this place or the other, but I'd LOVE to meet him/her or them. The service at this place it top notch and far surpasses that of any 5 star, fine dining establishments I've ever been to. I am a firm believer that food may come up short from time to time. Maybe a recipe wasn't followed. Maybe there's a new cook in the kitchen. Maybe they are so slammed the kitchen cant keep up, etc.. It's a bummer when that happens but most often people will return to try it again. But... a server is on stage, in front of their guests, until the last curtain call. They really have no room for error without getting scrutinized and skinned alive. And they tend to take the hit for the entire restaurant. If the food is bad, for some reason it's easier for people to take it out on the server. If it took an hour to get a table, somehow it's the servers fault. If an entree was missed and didn't make it out to the table...yep it's the server's fault. Am I wrong?
Well here is where I'm going with this. The service at Bobby Q is so cream of the crop, that  in the unfortunate event of any one of the above mentioned scenarios, I can't foresee it ever being an issue.
Our server Donald, was more than just an order taker. He was a true experience maker, and we had the best time with him. I asked him about a couple of cocktails I was torn on. He was honest about one of them, the Watermelon Cooler, and let me know it's not for everyone and it gets sent back quite a bit. I ordered it and LOVED it. It tasted like a Jalapeno infused, Watermelon Margarita. I love spicy margaritas and this cocktail was right up my alley!
The food was also superb. I had beef ribs as well as 1/2 rack baby backs, accompanied with Mashed Potatoes and Mac N CHeese!
PSA: There is absolutely no dainty way to eat the beef ribs. Just accept the facts, get in touch with your inner Caveman, and go to town! Nom, Nom, Nom... while you're feasting, try to remember you are in public, people may be watching, so keep the growling to a minimum.
At the end of our meal, we were so full, we regretfully declined dessert. We did however find a tiny bit of room for the complimentary mini donuts. I actually asked if we could order some to go. To my pleasant surprise, they sell them by the dozen! And, to my ultimate surprise our server brought us a few extra donuts, told us not to leave, and came back with a scoop of vanilla ice cream!! Whhaaaaaaat?? Omg... mind blown and super yummy! All in all Bobby Q. has it together from start to finish and you will not be disappointed! Be sure to ask for Donald, he's one of the best!

author: Luciana L.
review text:
Native Texan checking in and this place is solid.  Not as good as Texas bbq but the best we've had since moving to the valley.  It was so good in fact that hubs wants to inquire about holding a private event there for work.  So yeah, not bad at all!

We shared a 3 meat plate with brisket, baby back ribs and pulled pork.  Out of the 3, the brisket was my least favorite because I thought it was a bit dry but hubs didn't seem to think so.  He thought they were all pretty dang good.  My 3 year old devoured his mac and cheese.  It was pretty creamy and delicious.

We ordered the cornbread as an after thought so I was pretty full by the time it got to our table but it was so delicious I ate a whole one plus some.  It tastes almost like a desert because of the sweetness.  Perfection.

The decor is nice - very casual and bbq-like.  Service was good, too.  If you like bbq, you definitely need to check this place out!

author: Carrie F.
review text:
Defiantly worth the hype! For drinks I ordered the sangria and my Bf got the two IPA's on draft.  My sangria was good came in a glass mason jar.  My boyfriend enjoyed both IPA's.

Appetizer we ordered the Q ROLLS tasty deep fried brisket with a Bbq dipping sauce and spicy dipping sauce as well-I enjoyed the bbq as it was a little sweet how I like it!

Main course we split the prime rib & bbq chicken combo.  Combo comes with a potato and two sides.  We ordered the MAC AND CHEESE and OH MY GOD it was prob the best Mac and cheese I've had in a while---five stars alone!!!!. The other side was the veggies...eh wasn't a fan . The veggies they chose were onions? Squash and peppers, to me that just wasn't what I was expecting- I had in mind broccoli or cauliflower? Seemed like an odd choice

For  dessert we ordered the mud pie to go !

As a bonus they give you some homemade donuts for the road ( I was too stuffed but my bf said they were amazing)

Overall good pick, good music, and good service! Will be back for sure!

author: Dana A.
review text:
This was an interesting find. Upon arriving in Phoenix, i obv checked yelp to see what the best eats were. Based on the reviews, this seemed like a no brainer.

Its basically an off the highway stop for grub. The outdoor eating area looked more appealing than inside. The service was great but i just wasnt crazy about the bbq or drinks unfortunately. We shared the Q rolls and a both ordered the pulled pork sandwich. The Q rolls tasted like they were from Applebees and the pulled pork just wasnt juicy at all.  The mac n cheese was actually pretty good. Portions are pretty large also.

The drinks were 95% mixer. They give you unlimited cornbread which was different than your average. It was a circle of  soft and buttery goodness. They also give you free donuts at the end of your meal. These were the winner for me. THEY WERE SO GOOOOD!

However, the service was great! Our waiter was very attentive and offered if we wanted more cornbread and whatever else we needed.

I unfortunately would not return here again. It just seems like people like it cause its a convenient "real food" stop on the highway. Its definitely not the best bbq iv ever had and it is certainty not worth the hype. If i do return,  itll be for those damn donuts!

author: Bonnie S.
review text:
Went here for a meetup group event.   First off, I would like to say, if I was grading the cornbread, the mac and cheese and the mashed potato sides, I would give them a resounding five stars.   The service, I would give five stars as well.   It's the BBQ that I would give more like a two or three stars, hence, the three stars since that's probably what the place is known for.

There was probably about 20 of us.   We had two servers, which they were organized and kept things moving along.   Drinks came out in a timely fashion as well as the warm cornbread and butter, which I could have just made a meal from that!

I love pork ribs, as you can probably tell from my prior BBQ reviews.   We could either order a half or a full.   I figured, since I was filling up on the cornbread anyway, I could take most of it home and ordered the full rack.   I asked which was leaner, which our server stated it was the baby back.   I don't want all that pork fat.  

The ribs were, mehhhhh, okay.   A bit on the dry side; yes, falling off the bone, but it just lacked that bbq, smoky flavor that I am used to.   The sauce wasn't all that tantalizing either.

Now, the mac and cheese and the mashed taters, that was another thing.   I don't know what kind of cheese it is, but it was creamy and plenty of cheese.   The mashed taters had the skin, which I like, and was quite tasty as well.

I ordered a manhattan, which was good.   It's just that I think someone drank half of it before I got it since the glass was partially filled.   I was wondering what happened to the rest of it.

Would I return?   I would for everything except the Q.    I didn't care for the dryness of the meat and the blandness of the flavoring.

author: Alice H.
review text:
Great place for a large casual group BBQ dinner pig-out session.

~$25 for a 2 meat plate with 2 sides

Cornbread - On the house! So moist and soft that it falls apart if you try to grab it with a fork. Perfect amount of sweet and bread-y taste.

Q-rolls - brisket inside a croissant roll, tasty.

Brisket - the brisket here is so amazing tasty with the most tender consistency. I love it here, I could eat a bunch of it. Highly recommend getting brisket.

Baby Back Ribs - Very tender, falls off the bone and great flavor in the sauce.

Donuts - On the house! Made fresh, extremely warm with cinnamon on the outside. It's just like a churro in a donut form, YUM.

author: Angel F.
review text: This place did not disappoint!! Such amazing tasty Food. Too much food!! Everything was perfect. Food, Service, Cornbread, Meats, you won't be disappointed. Will definitely be back.

author: Savanna D.
review text: It was good, don't get me wrong. Portions are HUGE! Q rolls are a delicious appetizer (honestly could have gone for another order for my meal ). But the food was just ehhh (don't hate me) - nothing special. I recommend upgrading your fries to the beer fries (instead of the shoestring). The steak is REALLY Smokey if you're into that... it just wasn't what I was used to, so it wasn't my personal favorite.

author: Tina Z.
review text: Not the best ribs I've ever had but great sides and a pretty cool place to hang out with a large BBQ menu!

author: J W.
review text:
We tried:
Zucchini fries
Spinach artichoke dip, salsa verde & salsa roja & chips & breadsticks
Hog heaven: beef ribs, baby back ribs, brisket, chicken, Mac & cheese, fries, broccolini
Jumbo broiled shrimp

Lunch & dinner came with a basket of corn bread-- one round piece per person. It was hot, moist, and perfectly sweet & savory.
Zucchini fries were perfectly fried and dusted with Parmesan cheese-- a delicious appetizer I would order again
Artichoke dip was gone before I could try some, but everyone raved about how delicious it was
Q rolls: smoked brisket in phyllo dough. Absolutely delicious!

Meat: beef ribs were perfectly cooked with tons of smoke flavor. Absolutely delicious! My favorite of all the meat we tried.
Baby back ribs: fall of the bone tender-- covered in the perfect amount of BBQ sauce. Would definitely recommend trying.
Brisket: super tender, some tender & some lean. Absolutely perfectly smoked.
Chicken: breast was slightly dry and under seasoned.

Broccolini: perfectly cooked & seasoned. My favorite of all the sides.
Mac & cheese: slightly too salty, but a generous portion.
Fries: I prefer my fries to be shoestring, but these were cut a little too thinly for my taste.

Service: super nice & attentive despite how busy they were.

If you are visiting the Phoenix area you must try this place. It was so delicious that I went back the next day!

author: Arthur M.
review text:
It had been a while since the last time we had barbecue, so we decided to make an 8 PM Saturday night reservation at Bobby Q. We were very pleased with all the meats we sampled and the Yelp rating didn't let us down.

We had about a fifteen minute wait after we checked in at the host stand just after 8. The waiting areas were crowded and many people were waiting outside. I think a buzzer/text system would save some young ladies' voices and annoyance of the guests because when a table became available, the hostesses would yell out the name of the party at the top of their lungs while walking through waiting area.

We were served by Hunter and he did an excellent job of handling being triple sat with a total of 12 guests by treating the multiple tables as he should and serving all of us as one party of 12. He gave us a brief background of the restaurant also informing us that all the meat is smoked for over 20 hours using mesquite wood. The recommendations for food and beverage were solid. During the meal, my daughter did drop her fork on the ground and we requested on three different occasions for a new one and it was never brought to us.

For drink, I started with the Bobby Q's amber ale by Thunder Canyon Brewery which the caramel and malty flavor was an excellent pairing with the barbecue. Along with the warm cornbread to start, we were recommended the Q-Rolls ($10.50) which were a great preview of the meats to come ahead. The brisket was tender and moist wrapped in a crispy shell with a little kick added with a chipotle dip.

For entrees, my wife and I split the Whole Hog Heaven ($48) which was way too much food for two. All four of us could have split this meal. They were out of sausage that night so we went with the pork to go along with the baby back ribs, St. Louis ribs, and brisket. All of the meat was smoky, tender, and juicy. No tough, dry meat here. The sauce was pretty standard and served in a small pot which eliminated the sticky, messy bottles. My daughter and her friend split the Southern Fried Chicken ($14). I didn't get to taste any of the chicken, but they finished everything, which usually isn't the case.

We passed on dessert as everyone was stuffed, but the bag of doughnuts was a nice parting gift which I finished pretty much the whole bag later as a late night snack.

author: Cheryl W.
review text: I'll be very honest in saying, "I'm not sure if I should be reviewing this establishment". I say this because I'm not big on Barbecue, I'm not the rib or the brisket eater, so this review is based on the overall opinion of everyone in my party. Let's start with my Southern Fried Chicken, for me it was a bit disappointing, mainly because I didn't realize that it was going to be a boneless chicken breast (I blame myself for failure to pay attention to the menu description), it was very well cooked & seasoned, but just okay. I especially enjoyed the cornbread as did everyone at our table, so I do recommend the cornbread. The grill corn was good, but tasted a little like can corn. The Rib eaters absolutely loved their ribs and the brisket eaters had mixed emotions

author: Correen B.
review text:
Let's start this review out by making it clear that I am a "smoker".  In other words, I have my own rig, and I know how to use it.   My husband and I shared a "whole hog" meal.  St. Louis Ribs, Beef Ribs, Sausage and Brisket.  Of all of these meats, the only one that we didn't care for was the brisket.  Something was off and very mushy about it.  Brisket should be able to be pulled apart with your fingers, not completely fall apart like baby food.  For the sides we had baked potato, beans, and pecan coleslaw.  These were also great.

The atmosphere is somewhat contemporary, and very comfortable.  The service rocked!   It's no Mom and Pop place, but a great effort on their part for sure.

author: Michelle N.
review text:
Yes!!!! Everyone's meal was soooooooooo good!!! I was a little worried about the area this restaurant was in and got a little worried about the signs in parking lot that they aren't responsible for theft in cars! Yikes is this a problem here?

We decided to give it a try and we're glad we did stay!!!!  The mashed potatoes were sooooooooo good and so was the Mac n cheese! I highly recommend those sides!  The food was all amazing and they give you free donuts at the end! What what!!! How awesome!!!!  

We will visit again if we return to this area!

author: Ryan A.
review text: Chill spot, the dessert donuts they brought out after the meal were so so good! Could eat them all day! Good brisket and veggies. Had a great experience. Cool place

author: Nessa C.
review text:
I'm used to only hearing of Bobby Q as a club not as a restaurant.
I was quite surprised to see the other side! The hostess sat us quickly and were friendly. The server was great, attentive but not too invasive. I ordered the no Bobby Q rolls as an appetizer and wow I loved them! It tasted like a bbq mini chimichanga with a side of bbq sauce! For my entree I had the bbq pulled poke sandwich with shoe string fries and it was delicious! The service is great, our table was cleared as we finished our meals, our drinks refilled and had the manager come around and ask how our meals were!
I can't wait to go back and try more!
Great job to the kitchen and staff!

author: Winnie T.
review text:
All around amazing restaurant! I have seen this restaurant on a MUST try in a list somewhere but forgot the name. So I decided to enlist Yelp for help when I was in the Arizona area for Spring Training this year. What strike me was the 1300+ yelp reviews and the 4.5 stars rating. I knew I had to bookmark this. Reservation was easy as I did it on open table (4:30PM on a Monday).

My bf and I arrived earlier and sat at the bar. That's when I learned the hard way that Arizona has a law that prohibits selling alcohol to anyone with a vertical ID, even though they might passed the age of 21. (Yes, I'll be renewing my license this month as it expires next month). Oh well...

The full party arrived and we were led to a table for 6 in the back. We were promptly greeted by our server, Riley. He made us feel welcomed with his friendly attitude and provided us with a great recommendation for appetizer, the Q-roll! Everyone enjoyed it and it set a good note for the rest of the evening.

All the "adults" except me got the Bobby Q Amber Ale that went really well with the BBQ, while I got the frozen strawberry lemonade. It was delicious! They served us complimentary circular shaped cornbread before our main course, that was really good too. This is coming from someone that doesn't blink twice for cornbread. Then our order of the Whole Hog Heaven and a rack of the St. Louis Style Ribs came. That was the perfect amount for our group of 6 adults. We only had 2 ribs left and everyone was stuffed! To top off the amazing meal, our server gave us a bag of homemade cinnamon sugar donuts to take home. Overall, I was so glad my choice for dinner was a success!

Parking: A big private lot. There are spaces reserved for to-go orders.

Atmosphere: Outdoor patio, bar and dimly lit indoor seating.

Good for: Dates (not really for first dates unless you don't mind eating BBQ), catching up with friends, small and big groups (family, friends, celebration, birthdays, etc.)

Service: Super friendly and accommodating. Right when I entered, the hostess was smiling and ready to help. Our server was awesome!

Food: Amazing. Don't even need a knife, it just melts off the bone! Whole Hog Heaven for groups of 4! Try the Amber Ale or the frozen strawberry lemonade.

Apparently, they'll turn into a nightclub on St. Patrick's Day. I'll definitely be back if I'm back in this area! :)

author: Sasha E.
review text:
If you're ever cravin' some good ribs, steak, burgers... come down to Bobby Q's! My partner and I went here for date night and we were not disappointed. I ordered the ribs and they were dripping with flavor! My significant other had the burger with bacon (of course I had more than a few bites of his) and we both agreed it was the juiciest burger on the block. The macaroni and baked potato were SO delightful. It was a pretty busy evening for Bobby Q's but they managed very well by tending to their customers in a timely manner.

Their club opens at 11, we had seen people lining up to go in as we left, so you know it must be poppin'. We haven't came here for the club portion, but let my food go down and sooner than you know it I'll be out on the dance floor. Overall, we had a wonderful night; great atmosphere, awesome service & superb food. We even got little doughnuts as a dessert when we left. We will definitely be coming back! And I can't even wait until we come back because it was that good.

author: Steve S.
review text: After searching for a good BBQ place to try, based on high ratings and reviews,  my girlfriend found this restaurant and it looked like it was going to be great.  We did not get any alcohol drinks, but I tried their strawberry lemonade and it was great. For our meal, we had to go with the whole hog heaven. Being from out of town, this was a no brainer, as this combo had the best of everything. We were able to try baby back ribs, st louis ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. All of these meats were delicious. My favorite were the st louis ribs and the pulled pork, but everything was so good.  Not only that, but this combo meal came with 3 sides. We went with the pecan cole slaw, mac & cheese, and mashed potatoes.  Again, very delicious sides. This platter was so large in size, that we had plenty of left overs to take home (to finish up later that night plus the next day). The portion size was excellent compared to the price.  The waiter we had was great. Made our experience even better. It was a nice bonus we got some fresh made mini donuts to go in a bag on our way out. And I got a free refill lemonade drink to go as well. This was probably the best BBQ I have had at a restaurant.  I can see why it is rated so high. A+ recommendation from me. Everything from food to service was outstanding. Everyone must try this BBQ.

author: Leslie V.
review text:
I want to start off by saying, this is the BEST BBQ place I've ever had. The ratings and the reviews are all true. The best! My friend and I were in Phoenix for the weekend, and as soon as we checked in our hotel, we both were hungry and graving some BBQ. I personally was not expecting any good BBQ places nearby, we almost settled with a mediocre place at the Westgate shopping center! Glad my friend stumbled upon Bobby Q's. With over 1000+ reviews and still holding a 4.5 average rating, I came in with high expectations.

My first thought when arriving was this place was pretty hidden, there is plenty of parking, the restaurant is big, and best yet, it smelled great from outside already! We were a little worried it was going to be busy and would have to wait a bit for lunch because of its popularity, but we got greeted and were seated right away!

Our server Hunter greeted soon after and introduced himself and told us about Bobby Q and now they smoke their meats. He was extremely helpful and friendly and checks in on us frequently since he knew this was our first time. My friend and I each got the or own 3 meat combo which was only $25 and came with 2 sides! I chose the brisket, baby back ribs, and pulled pork with Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. We also ordered their blonde ale beer, which was good refresher.

We waited for our food, and were given corn bread. Which were amazing!! We had to stop ourselves before we got full from them. Our food came quicker than expected, and we were not disappointed. There was definitely more food than I was expecting. There was going to be leftovers for sure. Having the first bit was heaven and knew immediately this must've been the best BBQ I've ever had. Way better than the Wood Ranch here for sure. My favorite was the spicy BBQ that our server Hunter gave us. It had a little kick without it being to spicy. My friend and I enjoyed our plans until we were too full, which we barely ate half our plates. We were more than happy to have it for leftover dinner.

Before leaving, Hunter gave us complimentary donuts, which were a great touch, but we were way to full to have any, so added it on to our leftover bag.

Overall, this place was delicious! Service and food was excellent!  I will definitely have to stop by here when I come back to Phoenix.

author: Rachel M.
review text:
The food and service was amazing. At 830 on Wednesday night they asked us if we had a reservation that's how crowded they get. My husband did have the pulled port platter and the portion did look a little small compared to my baby back ribs. I got the full rack of ribs. It was amazing amazing! Their frozen lemonade is nothing special don't waste your money if anything it is too sweet!!

Ask for more cornbread and you can get your drink to go.

author: Serena Z.
review text:
My Guilty Pleasure:

Hands down one of my favorite places to eat in Phoenix and the top 5 best BBQ I've ever had. I have nothing negative to say about this place except you might feel a bit guilty after all the food you will have! The portions are pretty big without the big price tag. A dinner for 3 will cost you less than $50. Great atmosphere and usually good service also. Be prepared to wait about 15 minutes on weekends and the dinner rush if you do not have a reservation, but it is definitely worth the wait!

author: Fabby C.
review text:
All crappy restaurant owners should take note. Bobby Q is basically a textbook example of how to successfully run a restaurant properly.    

Bobby's claims it was voted the Best BBQ in the US, although I'm not sure of their source? Nevertheless, I'd have a hard time arguing, as it definitely sets the bar extremely high. We've been here several times and have never had a bad meal. In fact, virtually everything we've tried on the menu seems to be done correctly.

The pulled pork, which is my preferred way to eat BBQ, always manages to impress me with its flavor. For sides, I've had the mashed potatoes and the mac and cheese, which is far superior to that low-grade sludge they try to get away with dishing out at all of these other places in Phoenix. Even their fries are better than you'd expect.

The place is decorated to the point where, if I didn't know any better, I would have wrongfully assumed it was a chain restaurant. But yet, I like that, despite their popularity, they haven't decided to branch out and open up 20 different locations all over the city (and I actually hope they never do for quality and consistency purposes).

I've always wondered if their steaks are equally as good as their BBQ, but I've never wanted to sacrifice the taste of a great pulled pork sandwich in order to find out. And we're always so full after our meals that we've never been able to try some of their desserts. Based on their Yelp pictures, it seems like many people are in the same boat.

But, like all business owners should know, it's the little things that go a long way. The complimentary cornbread you receive before your meal is both unique, yet extremely well done. Oh, and that's not all. On your way out, you also get treated to a little bag of their homemade donuts, which you can often spot being made whenever you first walk in. I've said many times that it's little touches like that keep customers coming back - and it most definitely works. It's not rocket science and I'm amazed that other restaurants have failed to adopt this well-received approach.

Easily one the best BBQ experience in all of Phoenix and a great all-around business!

author: Jas T.
review text:
It's our first time in Phoenix and we decided to visit Bobby Q to check it out. I made our reservation from yelp and it worked very well. We even received a 10% discount for checking in thru yelp.

Our meal started with delicious complimentary cornbread. I don't think I have enough words to describe how delicious ALL the food that we ordered specially the BRISKET and Chicken BBQ!
Bobby Q exceeded our expectations! They also have generous portion its good for sharing and worth every buck! HIGHLY recommended for your BBQ cravings!

author: Jem K.
review text:
Delicious! The meat falls right off the bone. The whole hog heaven can easily feed 4 people and gives you good variety.  The Mac and cheese did not disappoint. Im not a fan of mac and cheese, but
I'm glad we tried it. a must try.

Service is really great. My nephew has food allergies and our server and manager explained to us which kid's meal would be good and not. They also made sure that his food was cooked separately to avoid cross contamination. Overall a good experience. BBQ heaven indeed.

Btw, they give you free cornbread, free heavenly dessert donuts and 10% off if you check in on yelp

author: Arron A.
review text:
Anyone that doesn't give this place at least 4 stars probably thinks Burger King is real food.

This place has consistently provided the wife and I with amazing food for over 10 years.

author: Cliff C.
review text: If you like meat, Go here. I got the 3 meat combo. It was big. It takes 2 to down this. The staff at the bar was great. Also the manager stopped by. Cool place to go. Food was really good. Eat people, eat here.

author: Will X.
review text:
Passing through Phoenix, we naturally turned to yelp for what to get. Bobby Q seemed to be a popular option is we decided to go for it. And it did not disappoint.

Went around noon on a Saturday and it wasn't too too packed. There's a nice outdoor area with lights and a fountain of sorts. (would try to avoid the back - sometimes there's one or tow more flies flying around).

We got the hogs heaven (a family style mix and match) and got the brisket, St Louis ribs, pork and ribs with a couple of sides. And wow it was amazing. Everything is so delicious and just melts in your mouth. The bbq sauce great too. Neither bland nor too sweet.

On top of it, the service was amazing. Our server was especially nice and took care of us well. Even if she were busy, she'd send another server to check in on us. This place is definitely  a must try.

author: Ngc B.
review text:
Food: 5/5 (I'm 100% satisfied)

Service: 5/5 (Staff super friendly)

Parking: 5/5 ( A lot of space available)

Atmosphere: 5/5 (Nice and cool)

Even water tastes different here. This is my first time to come and eat at this restaurant. And now I understand why this business spot got so many excellent and high reviews on Yelp.

Going to a restaurant does not simply means putting your butt on the chairs and eating what ever they give you. It also means enjoying your meal and satisfying your taste.

Bobby Q just has everything it need to be the best Phoenix steakhouse. The price is not too bad if I compare to what I enjoy when eating here. My friend and I ordered the Two Rib Combo which includes two sides. We want to share, so the staff put on two different plates for us. We finish our lunch with ice cream. We decided to pick Death by chocolate, but the guy recommend me to pick Miss Mcgee's Mud Pie. That was delicious.

We came there pretty early, only three tables have people. But when we left, they were all full. Such a popular and crowded business.

My dad is a steak lover, so next time I will bring my family here. I know he will love it.

author: David T.
review text:
Great service and atmosphere, tons of parking, and the food is awesome.

We tried the Whole Hog heaven ($51). The Whole hog heaven is too much for one person. We tried getting one 'whole hog' each but no way anyone could come close to finishing it individually. Leftovers for a few more meals!

The brisket is amazing, just incredible, juicy, melt in mouth-type of meat, I personally think I would come back just to eat this. Baby back ribs are so good, I actually enjoy less fat vs the St Louis. The sausage is also super tastyans juicy.

The sides like potato salad, pecan cole slaw, and grilled veggies were solid.

author: Dave K.
review text:
Meat literally fell off the baby back rib bone. No seriously, I'm talking about the meat on my rib bones effortlessly - no fork, no knife, no touch. Just pick up the rib and bam!

And that brisket? Smoky, tender, soft, meaty & sweaty pieces of brisket chunk topped with Bobby's own BBQ sauce was heavenly.

Starter: Q Rolls or bust. Think deep fried rolls with brisket inside, served with both BBQ and chipotle sauce.

To finish the meal, your server will come thank you with fresh out of the oven donuts. I was beyond irate at this fattening gesture but secretly loving their staff truly from the bottom of my heart. The ring of meat sweat glistening on my forehead tells all.

Don't worry Bobby Q, you will forever be my Phoenix go-to restaurant. Can't wait to try your burger and steak soon. Until next time, I need to shed some lbs.

author: Jen T.
review text:
One of the most popular BBQ places around. When we're here, it's protein time! My boyfriend and I ordered the three meat combo (baby back ribs, beef brisket, pulled pork) with 2 sides (mac & cheese and fries); and we split the order between the two of us. The meat from the baby back ribs was super tender, and easily fell off the bone - just the way I like it. The beef brisket was also tender, and very flavorful. The pulled pork was extremely juicy, giving you that gratification when you bite into it. Two thumbs up on their meat. Nothing spectacular about the mac & cheese and fries though.

Service was great. I was with some friends who have never been here before, and the waitress patiently explained the menu. She also made some good recommendations to them. I was very happy with her fast service, splitting the check amongst our group correctly and quickly getting out those togo boxes.

The best part about having a full belly at the end of your dinner is getting free complimentary donuts. I can't say "no" to sugar donuts! Love this place.

author: Bob F.
review text:
As a relatively new transplant from the Bay Area I lamented the lack of great , independently owned restaurants here in the Phoenix area- particularly given that I live pretty far north up the 17 near Happy Valley with little more than national chains. But a friend suggested I try this place for great BBQ so last week I took the 17 minute drive and was absolutely knocked out on a number of levels.

The service of this establishment is superb. It is one of the best managed restaurants I've ever patronized and the staff, from the bartender to the server all operated at a very high standard.

Now as for the food, one night I had their St Louis style ribs SANS the extra sauce ( I am a dry rub guy) and they were superb. Not fatty at all, tasty,  and the meat fell off the bone. Good fries and a very nice pecan coleslaw. Buy the chicken tender appetizer? OMG! By far and away the best I have had anywhere in the country!

Last night I enjoyed the fried chicken which is actually a butterflied breast of chicken - also excellent. The friendly gentleman sitting next to me at the bar had their prime rib and LOVED it. It looked AWESOME!

A big shout out to the manager Taylor who handled a minor issue ( my bad, not Bobby Q) in a MOST professional way. If in Phoenix you absolutely MUST go and if you're coming in for only 3 or 4 days, I would absolutely recommend you place Bobby Q on your list as those restaurants you simply cannot overlook on your trip to the desert.

author: Kristie M.
review text: The best BBQ in arizona. I recommend this place food was awesome and the service was a 10.

author: Jennifer L.
review text: Came here for lunch.  We got the Q-rolls and people aren't kidding - they were delicious.  I had the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese.  Everything was really good.  My husband had ribs and brisket and scarfed them down.  I was really stunned by the prices though - really high in my opinion.  Food was good, service was good, but it was pricy enough to prevent me from returning on a regular basis.  Entrees ranged from $17-40.

author: Chelsea L.
review text: Went here solely based on the reviews. There was a lot of people for a Wednesday night but they do accept reservations. I would highly suggest making reservations especially if coming on a weekend. The outdoor patio was amazing. I felt like I was not in the middle of the desert. It felt airy and romantic. Highly recommended if you like BBQ.

author: Edison O.
review text:
I've been to this bbq place twice now. Every visit has been an excellent experience.

Place:  Both indoor and outdoor dining area are clean, well lit and kept cool. Menu was easy to read properly organized. Restrooms looked and smelled clean.

Service: Received by staff with a smile. Leanne (our server) explained the menu and informed us that they smoke their meat low and slow. She always checked on our food and asked us if we needed anything else. We asked for a different sauce every time she visited our table and she provided us options every time. Manager visited our table to check on the sevice and food. I appreciate it when staff makes sure we are enjoying our visit.

Food: Exceptional bbq!!! Prime brisket was juicy and tasty. Baby back ribs were very tender and falls off the bone but still has that chewy texture that releases more flavor. Sausage is sweet and garlicy. A perfect pair for something starchy like mashed potato or rice. Beef ribs are tender and the fat around it is full of smoky goodness. Corn bread is a sweet and salty goodness. Want a great appetizer, try the Q-rolls.

I'll be back. This will be my go to BBQ in AZ.

author: Lori I.
review text:
"I LIKE PIG BUTTS and I cannot lie"

When visiting a new city, I try to eat things we don't have in Hawaii. Good BBQ is one of them so I'm no expert, but this place was so finger-licking-I'm-on-vacay-screw-my-diet good! Since we only had one shot to try everything, we tried the sampler:

WHOLE HOG HEAVEN $48
2 choices of ribs (we got baby back and St. Louis, I would get double baby back next time)
2 choices of meat (we got pulled pork and brisket, totally would get that again)
3 sides (we got roasted corn, beans, grilled veggies, but the shoestring fries were also very good)

KIDS MENU too! The kids had the chicken strips (which is like the breaded processed kind you get in the freezer), which they absolutely enjoyed because it is familiar to them. The key to a good kids menu is to offer things kids like (not mini versions of the adult food), and they do very well here. (We also ordered the appetizer chicken tenders, which is more like real chicken, real batter and they didn't like that as much.)

BBQ sauce- when asked if we wanted extra sauce, (regular or spicy?) I asked for both. I thought they'd bring little containers but hallelujah they thought of everything-we got little coffee pots of sauce brought to the table. Try the meat first before you drown it with sauce because it really needs no sauce! But I love sauce. I dipped the fries in it, the corn in it, the beans in it, I love good sauce. We (or I) emptied both pots of sauce, but TRY THE SPICY sauce! It's not that spicy and was delicious!

Service was great, and the little things like complimentary cornbread cakes and cute freshly made on the spot "THANK Q" cinnamon sugar donuts was a nice treat!
Highly recommend!

author: Esther J.
review text:
Tasty BBQ! We ordered the lunch sampler plate and picked brisket, baby back ribs, and BBQ chicken! Also got a chicken cranberry salad! The BBQ meats were very tender and flavorful! The salad was fresh and tasted good, too! They give you complementary corn bread in the beginning of the meal and freshly fried donuts after the meal :)
Country music playing in the restaurant~ there's also an outdoor patio area with string lights that look very pretty.

author: Vincent T.
review text: This place is probably one of my favorite spots in the valley to take a date. Although the area is not so nice, the inside is pretty nice. The food is always delicious. I always get the 14oz prime rib and it never disappoints. The sides that I order are usually their beer battered fries (which are not on their menu but highly recommend!) and their mac n cheese. You can make a meal out of their mac n cheese alone. It's completely thick and creamy.

author: Brad W.
review text: Well the third burger wasn't the charm. The burger arrived woefully under cooked and dripping red juices - pretty gross. The manager and staff were really nice, offering to replace it, but I did not want to take a chance and ended up just eating coleslaw and some baked potato. Eventually, the manager did comp the entire meal and the cornbread and free donuts were all at their usual best. The brisket stuffed baked potato fared better. Itb was just an off night for the cook, so we will return.

author: J Z.
review text: Such a treat to eat here! While you're waiting for your order they bring corn muffins and butter to your table,  nice touch. My boyfriend and I shared the 3 meat plate with 2 sides of mac n cheese. We also got a side of the baked beans. The mac n cheese was cheesy and satisfying. The baked beans weren't my cup of tea but my bf loved them. The ribs just melt in your mouth! The chicken is delicious. And the Brisket is good too but we were so full we couldn't finish it! I love how they serve their house made bbq sauce in a pourable container like it's gravy lol. We're definitely planning on coming back and trying something else!

author: Andrew W.
review text:
Bobby Q is one of my favorite places to go whenever I have family or friends new to Arizona. It has fantastic, flavorful, smoky BBQ options in a clean spacious dining area. With all the choices and sides, it has something for all lovers of BBQ.

My favorite starter is the Q-Rolls; but who could resist a crispy eggroll stuff with their delicious and tender smoked brisket. And usually we order the Whole Hog Heaven, which really is a feast for everyone eating it. You get to pick two ribs, two meats, and three sides. You cannot go wrong with anything you chose. I usually get the baby back ribs, St. Louis ribs, smoked sliced beef brisket, and smoked pulled pork with a side of sweet potato fries, pecan cole slaw, and mac & cheese.

What I recommend:
-- Q-Rolls
-- Whole Hog Heaven
-- smoked sliced beef brisket
-- baby back ribs

author: J'me W.
review text:
I have used Bobby Q'S for years for major events and dinner. I not only would try to eat here as much as possible I catered them for my wedding reception, and several family parties.

So since I have moved to Houston I went here as soon as I came home. For Texas to be known for BBQ I can say Bobby slays the majority of them with his cooking. Not only is all the meat good but the side dishes are out of this world.

We ordered the Whole hog heaven which is a BBQ lovers dream. We choose both Baby back ribs and St. Louis-TENDER FALL OF THE BONE

Brisket-Incredible but most importantly consistent. for all the years I have been coming it is always melt in your mouth incredible.

Chicken-So tender and smoky I die

Sides
Mac and Cheese-Always so delicious although this time it was slightly off, I couldn't put my finger on it. I would like to believe it was just a bad batch, because its always so creamy and full of velvetta, YES.

Potato Salad-Perfectly seasoned too perfection, Served super cold and reminds you of summer.

Corn bread-From scratch moist and sweet. You could eat a pound of these.

BBQ Sauces-Hot and Reg-Thick, balanced and rich the only type of sauce that should be on BBQ. Think Sweet Baby Rays X10

Last the complimentary donuts- DO NOT MISS THESE TREASURES.

author: Jennifer H.
review text:
Growing up, Bobby McGee's Restaurant used to be a staple eatery that my family and friends loved. We knew we could get good food and enjoy a setting that was colorful, eclectic, and maybe even charming in its own special way... if that's not too far-fetched..all at the same time. Once I moved onto college, and others went their separate ways, we all forgot about Bobby McGee's. It would often be a topic that would arise at a dinner convo, "What ever happened to that one place we used to go to near 27th Avenue and Northern?" But that was all that ever materialized.

Luckily, I was reunited with this restaurant, now known as Bobby-Q's. It has since transitioned into a Kansas City/Texas mixture type barbecue, but still a great atmosphere! After a long day of rock climbing, my friends and I were famished and they suggested getting barbecue. Once we arrived, all the memories started flooding back of this place, and I love what it's become. The barbecue is really good! It's actually one of my favorites, I'm surprised to say. Three of us shared the Whole Hog Heaven, which is a major platter where you can choose 2 ribs, 2 meats, and 3 sides. Our selections: the Baby Back ribs, the beef ribs, pulled pork, beef brisket, potato salad, macaroni and cheese, and grilled veggies. The rib meat was tender and "fall off the bone" type texture. The  baby back ribs were by far my favorite of the bunch.

While waiting for our order, our group also shared the smoked brisket Q-rolls with chipotle dip. These were really delicious but kind of reminded me of eating a mini chimi since the phylo dough was so flaky and crispy. There was a small heap of roasted corn served on the plate as well that was super smoky in flavor.

Even though it is the middle of winter, the patio was still very comfortable since all the heaters overhead were on. There is a metal waterfall sculpture that extends the entire length of the patio so it is very soothing and entertaining to have the sound of "rain" behind you as you're eating outside. Ashlynn, our waitress, was very accommodating to our large group of 7 that even included 3 super energetic kids. She even treated us with extra doughnuts at the end when we were finishing our meal. We will definitely return again and again to Bobby Q's!

author: Brittany C.
review text:
This was my first time at Bobby Q's. I have had catering from here before many times and it's always delicious but this was my first time at restaurant. The restaurant is a little hidden off the free way but it's very pretty inside and has a big lot light up patio that is pretty at night time.

Food was super good, service was great, and a very  modern/fun atmosphere. This would be a great place for date night, family dinner, and even late night drinks. They serve cornbread to start which is delicious and then end the meal with complimentary fresh cinnamon sugar donuts with your bill. I got the loaded BBQ brisket baked potatoe which was very good and large portion. It came with a side of the mac n cheese which was the best I have ever had. My fiancé got the ribs which he said were amazing and the meat just fell off the bone. They serve the meals with home made hot BBQ sauce which is delicious.

Price is moderate to high depending on what you get. You could get a big platter to share with a few people for a good price. I will definitely be back and continue to use them for catering . Highly recommend!

author: Michael S.
review text:
Brought my In-Laws from All the way from New Mexico to eat here and we stay in Gilbert AZ!!!! The service was outstanding!!
MICHAEL our server did an outstanding job and was very pleasant and helpful.
JASON the manager came over and asked how everything was.

AGAIN the service and food were freaking great. Thank You Bobby Qs for making this Son In Law from New Mexico look good!!!

author: Stephanie R.
review text: Hands down best bbq other than when my boyfriend cooks! The service was excellent, the patio was nice and warm and the decor was so nice. I came to eat here with my dad and we both ate the beef brisket dinner. The Mac and cheese was delicious and so were the beans. The cornbread was yummy with butter too! The only thing I didn't like was the spicy bbq sauce because it tasted watered down and lacked flavor. But I would  definitely recommend trying this place. They also had a good selection of beers and unique cocktails!

author: Ravin L.
review text:
Definitely liked this place. After my cousin convinced me to come here (because I'm not a huge fan of BBQ) I was pleased. I ordered the country fried chicken. It comes with mash potatoes and choice of one side (I chose Mac&Cheese....I know two starches). The cornbread is complimentary, super hot and yummy. My friend ordered the baby back ribs with Mac and baked potatoes (2 starches again). I tried some of her ribs and they were really good, falling off the bone good. I definitely would come back when I visit Arizona. I would love to try the pulled pork or the beef brisket. At the end of your meal they give you a bag of complimentary donuts that resembles the taste of churros.

My waiter was really nice and very attentive to us as we told him it was our first time dining at the establishment. The manager even walked over to us to make sure everything was fine. The staff appeared to be really nice and courteous.

author: Zaa G.
review text:
Since we're being completely honest and all, my husband and I were originally planning on going to Little Miss BBQ but found out mid uber ride that they weren't even open. But boy were we oh so happy that they were because we ended up finding Bobby Q's.

Again, sticking to the whole honesty thing, we loved everything about this joint. From the moment we walked in and saw just how charming the venue was to the exceptionally good customer service they delivered, this place was on point. Our waiter even had the perfect balance of knowing when to check on us and when not to. He kept our drinks topped off and was so knowledgeable about everything they had. You could tell the staff took pride in working there.

We shared a dinner combo: ribs and top sirloin with a baked potato, mac n cheese, and roasted corn. We also shared their signature mud slide pie. Everything was good but let me break this feast down to my personal favorites:

The Ribs - I can totally see why they'd be dubbed "World Famous" for it. I mean, the meat literally falls right off the bone while maintaining the right amount of tenderness you can only find in a perfectly slow-smoked BBQ.

The Roasted Corn - I've never had anything like it. It's rich with buttery goodness and makes a stance with the char it leaves in your mouth long after you've digested. This is one of those sides that shouldn't even be a side, it's just. that. good.

Bobby Q's, thank you for being open when all the competitors were closed - you guys have officially left me with a tasteful experience I will never forget.

author: Troy D.
review text: I have to admit that I love the smoked meats at BobbyQ.  They are as close as I've had to real smoked brisket since I lived in Texas.  The cornbread is good and always comes with your meal.  Don't forget the mini doughnuts like you would get at the state fair that they bring with your final bill.  Sometimes the wait staff doesn't seem to know how to deliver great service and what is up with putting ice in the urinals?  It doesn't seem sanitary to do this, but the bathrooms are always clean, it's just the ice in the toilet is weird.  I would defiantly recommend this place to anyone for a beer or wine and smoked meats.  One of the best in Phoenix that's for sure!

author: Mike M.
review text:
On a visit to Arizona about a week ago I stopped by here for lunch before flying home. This is a nice barbecue restaurant that has an attractive interior along with a bar area. The hostess seated me and it took about 10 minutes before a waiter showed up. The restaurant was about 1/2 full and the waiter said he didn't see me seated. I ordered the smoasted chicken plate with beans, cole slaw and cornbread along with a salad. The salad arrived first and was good. What I didn't like was that the entree arrived just a few minutes later and I hadn't finished my salad and I am not a slow eater. I hurried to finish the salad because I didn't want to food to get cold.

The chicken was average size and looked just like chicken that I cook on the grill. The cole slaw had pecans on it and was very good (4). I liked the beans too and graded them at a 3.5. The salad was good also and I gave it a 3. I liked the chicken but felt it only deserved a 3. Not bad but I have had many examples that were better. That's why my overall score for the meal is a 3.

Perhaps my tardy waiter and the fact that the timing of the service was off were a fluke. I believe this is a good restaurant and probably is closer to a 3.5 or maybe even a 4. However that was my experience.

author: Laura A.
review text:
According to Tripadvisor Bobby Q is the Highest Rated BBQ in Arizona. Bobby Q is a very large old fashioned looking restaurant. I don't know how old it is but to me it looks a hundred years old with Giant Old Trees shading the parking lot. As you walk in you do get hit with an aromatic BBQ aroma.

We were quickly seated and our server gave us a fast run down on Bobby Q. We learned that everything is made in house and the meats are smoked with mesquite wood. They also start everybody out with what I recognize as Johnny Cakes with soft whipped butter.

I had the BBQ Pulled Chicken Sandwich with Pecan Cole Slaw. The Chicken was falling apart tender and laced with sweetness but not too much. A small amount of skinny fried onions were added to my sandwich on a soft grilled roll. The coleslaw was drip free and fresh and crunchy.

My husband had a much better value item called the lunch sampler plate with 3 meats and a side. He enjoyed everything. I tried a taste of the brisket and for me it was too succulent and fatty but for my husband who likes fat he thought it was just right. My husband ate the macaroni and cheese I have to say it tasted like processed cheese. I didn't like the macaroni and cheese but I know most people do like this style. My husband liked the beans too he said they were packed with all kinds of meat ends.

When you're all done they present you with a bag of Fresh Made Thank "Q" Cinnamon  Sugar Donuts.

Not my stye of BBQ but I still thought it was good and plan to return for dinner.

author: Stacy F.
review text:
Loved this place - of course, another great find from Yelp!

We were in the area, and headed on in due to great reviews. Can I just say - holy cow giant drinks! We ordered our drinks and they came out in fun "glasses." And when I say glasses, I mean his was a ginormous martini style glass and my so-called glass was a cut out pineapple. The people at the table next to us on the patio were like...um, what did you two order?? We had no answers for them other than...awesomeness apparently! I've had some small martinis for $10 before...so this was just...whoa.

I had the pulled pork and mac and cheese. I will admit that the pulled pork was a bit dry, but a little extra BBQ sauce and that's an easy fix. Plus the BBQ sauce was delicious, so it gave me an excuse to use more! Win.

The mac and cheese was, for lack of a better word, luscious. Creamy, cheesy and everything good southern style comfort food mac and cheese should be.

The real winner here for me was hands down the cornbread though. I'm a huge cornbread fanatic, and theirs was true southern to the core. Well done Bobbby Q, well done.

Overall: A+
Some good southern BBQ with great sauce and great sides. And...the drinks..I mean seriously...the drinks!

author: Jen W.
review text:
Whoa.  Fantastic BBQ.  Out of the numerous places I've been to, Texas and all, Bobby Q wins numero uno at this point.

It's really hard to find good brisket.  Bobby Q has GREAT brisket...the best I've ever had.  And yes, even better than the places I've been to in Texas.  The BBQ overall was better than what I've had in Texas.
