We ordered a 3 meat combo platter with ribs, sausage, and brisket.  Our sides included pecan cole slaw and mac n cheese.  The cole slaw wasn't very tasty or flavorful.  The mac n cheese was cheesy, creamy, and yum.  We also ordered a side of veggies to make us feel better about our meal.  Haha.  

It was busy but we were able to get a table right away.  Service was decent.  Parking gets a little packed but you'll find a space somewhere.  

Oh, and at the end of the meal...you get fresh donuts sprinkled in cinnamon sugar FTW!  Yes!  Yes!  Yes!  (Yes, that's my Hunter Pence chant.)  

Bobby Q is doing everything right and I'm so glad I got to try it.  Gives me another reason to come back and visit Phoenix!

author: Nicholas M.
review text:
I love the restaurant. The ambience and service here are outstanding. The food meets expectations but does not exceed them.
The brisket was almost on the dry side but good. The chicken was fantastic. The beef ribs were not very meaty but were sweet and tasty.
My real complaint was the ribs. The baby back ribs were good, but a little overdone. I couldn't pick them up without them falling apart. Personally, I think they should be firm enough to hold together when you cut them and pick them up. But if I give the bone a firm tug, it should come out. It's a fine line and easy to cross. Bobby Q crosses the line, but all in all it's a very good BBQ joint. Given the competition in Arizona, it's easy to see why they are so successful.

author: Pauline C.
review text:
All you need to know is... PULLED PORK!!! It is seriously one of the best pulled pork I've ever had! I'm from California and we are blessed with Phil's BBQ and my sister and I prefer Bobby Q over Phil's BBQ!

What We Ordered
- Beef Brisket with Mac and Cheese and Mashed Potatoes
- 2 Meat Combo: Pulled Pork and Beef Brisket with Mac and Cheese and Mashed Potatoes
- Steak Sandwich with Shoestring Fries
- Catfish Po Boy Sandwich with Roasted Corn

The complimentary corn bread was good! Very moist! The beef brisket was good! The meat was tender but I felt that I needed to add the bbq sauce for it to taste better. The Mac and Cheese was super duper cheesy!! I loved it!! The Mashed Potatoes were really good as well! Super buttery and smooth.

The Pulled Pork (not pictured because my sister was sitting too far) was AMAZING. It was good by itself or with the bbq sauce! I really wished I ordered this instead, like I originally planned. Luckily, my sister let me sample some of hers. :) My Mom enjoyed her catfish po boy. She's really picky so that's telling you something lol. My Sister and Mom loved the roasted corn!

The only bad dish was the Steak Sandwich but I don't know if that's because my Dad ordered it medium well. He said it was too chewy and had no flavor. His shoestring fries were really, really salty and soggy! He was very upset, to say the least lol.

They give you little sugar donuts, (Thank Q's), at the end of the meal! They were so cuteeee! They were just average tasting but I enjoyed the fact that they were free! I will come back for the Pulled Pork!

author: Paige T.
review text:
Amazing sides with good BBQ

Positives:
I used to go here when it was Bobby McGees growing up. It is completely different now.  It's very nice on the inside. Been there twice and once was for a party we got our own private room!  Our staff was amazing!! So tentative and everything came out great.

The sides are my weakness here. Their potato salad is super good!! Mac n cheese is wonderful. Good slaw. The bbq is very good also. I would not say it's the best I've ever had.. But it is defiantly worthy of eating and paying for. Yummy!! We all loved our food.

Negatives:
I don't have any complaints.

author: Chuck M.
review text: Absolutely some of the best barbecue I've ever had! It was actually so good my coworkers and I came here two nights in a row for dinner. Last night I had the sliced prime beef brisket, grilled vegetables and Pecan coleslaw. The beef brisket was moist, tender, and flavorful. The barbecue sauce was both sweet and tangy but not too much of either; my mouth is watering just talking about it again! Tonight I had the two meat dinner which included the prime beef sliced brisket and smoked pulled pork. Again the dish was absolutely perfect, with the pulled pork being just as good as the sliced beef! The service on both nights was equally good, the waiters were friendly and courteous. We didn't make reservations either night but the three of us were seated within 20 minutes on both visits. The place has a surprisingly nice ambience for a barbecue restaurant. You definitely don't want to miss this place if you're in Phoenix and really enjoy BBQ.

author: Jeremiah Z.
review text:
Recently voted one of the top 100 barbecue places on yelp, this is a must visit if you're in the Phoenix area.

The backyard patio is beautifully lit, has a really cool waterfall, and there are mister machines on the ceiling which help on those really hot Phoenix summer days.

Their food was excellent! I had the big potato with brisket on top and a side of sweet potato fries. It was amazing! This we potato fries are seasoned with a hint of cinnamon which makes him quite... sweet. It was the perfect amount of food. The chipotle ranch sauce that came with the sweet potato fries had a zesty finish.

I would definitely come back!

author: Mark H.
review text:
After reading several reviews about how good the brisket was I decided I had to try it. I went over on a Friday afternoon and sat at the bar. They had the lunch menu and their dinner menu and I noticed the lunch brisket was only around three dollars less expensive then the brisket platter. The bartender said that the dinner platter was a better value so that's what I went with. I opted for the fries and the coleslaw as the two sides. I have to say the brisket was amazing. Not only was it very tender but it was not at all dried out like so many other places that I have tried. Even people from Texas would be impressed.  My only minor complaint was the fries could have been crispier. I also have to say that I really like their ice tea as well.

There are so many interesting options on the menu I deafly will be coming back to this place to try them out.  

I haven't been to Bobby Q's for a few years. The last time was meeting up with friends from work for a going away party. They had a special room in the back for us. The appetizers we had were very good.

This place has really nice atmosphere. It would be a great place to bring somebody for that first date. Service is also very good. When I was finished the bartender gave me a fresh iced tea to go. That was greatly appreciated on a hot day.

Their busiest day of the year was Father's Day. I was there at about 2:30 pm and the wait was between an hour and a half and hour and 45 minutes long so I didn't stay but I knew I would have to come back soon. And I'm glad I did.

author: Rick T.
review text:
4.5 stars.....I really battled over scoring this fine establishment. So let me break it down:

Setting: 5 stars-Great decor, lots of televisions, dim lighting, and just a comfortable feel.

Staff:  5 stars- Our waiter was awesome. I am very frustrated with myself for not remembering his name. He checked on us often and really took care of my party of 8. The manager also walked by and checked on us. Class act all the way around.

Food: 4.5 stars- The food was great. The sides (French fries, potato salad, Cole slaw, Mac and cheese) were awesome. Each side could not have been any better. As for the meat, it too was very good. The problem I have is I compare everything now to the barbecue spot Little Miss Barbecue.  The meat (pulled pork, brisket, ribs, and ribeye) was moist and flavorful. Better then Little Miss? No, but it was darn good. I really would love to give the meat a five but that would not be fair to Little Miss. For dessert, we knocked out the bread pudding and their complimentary mini donuts. The bread pudding was not on their menu but it needs to be. It needs to be their go to dessert. It was amazing!!!!! Loved it!!! LOVED IT!!! The donuts were so fresh and a real treat.

Bobby Q's is legit for sure. I would and will stop by again. I really wish I could give it 4.5 stars. What a nice meal/time.

author: Nichole B.
review text: This place puts me into a pretty good meat coma every single time I go.  I blame the restaurant.  The food is so good that I can't stop shoveling it into my face, even when I know it's quitting time.  The brisket is the best I've ever had, excellent roast corn and mac and cheese, and strawberry colada is a total mouthgasm.  It's very cozy in the restaurant and nice and dark so that you don't have to be ashamed as you're smearing rib sauce all over your face.  But seriously....this is the best BBQ I have had in the Phoenix area so far.  So go!

author: Bobby P.
review text:
There's no reason you should not go to this restaurant. Their food speaks for itself, my ribs fell off the bone and were absolutely delicious. The lemonade (frozen) blew my mind.
I went for my birthday and had a group of 12, the staff was unaware of this and still put us in a private room and my water cup was never empty.

author: Michelle M.
review text: This place was a good dinner spot. I love bbq and I found this place on yelp. I didn't find the sauce on my Baby back ribs to be anything special but the ribs were cooked pretty darn well. We also had a rib eye steak, Mac and cheese actually had real cheese in it, it was very tasty.

author: Nate S.
review text:
My wife and I ordered the Whole Hog Heaven. The meat was spectacular! Ribs were smoked to perfection, chicken was juicy, and the pork was great! The two suggestions we have are to make the tables for two a little bigger (would have been fine if we ordered something different), and provide moist towlets for cleaning your hands after eating the ribs. Those suggestions don't affect the rating I gave 'cause the food was just too good!
As for the service, our waitress was fast friendly and very informative! Next time I am in Phoenix I will be back to Bobby Qs!

author: Jared V.
review text:
(Before I say anything, order the Q Rolls. I don't see a single possible way anyone could be disappointed by them. Unless you don't eat meat, and then I feel sorry for what you're missing out on.)

Finally went off the beaten path (literally) and tried Bobbie Q's after years and years of driving right by it along the I-17. If you're anything like me, you thought it may have looked a little questionable from the freeway. Old perhaps, run down, neglected? Let me assure you, none of these are the case at all. Once you navigate the side streets to find this hidden gem, you are sure to be pleasantly surprised just as we were.

Prepare to be greeted at the hostess station inside a beautifully kept up and clean dining room. You may notice the donut machine just behind the hostesses making fresh little donuts which will be warm and waiting for you on the way out. Once seated, I highly recommend you order the Q Rolls, as stated at the beginning of the review. The beef brisket wrapped up inside them is out of this world good. Great dipping sauces too.

For the entrees, we had a loaded baked potato with shredded chicken, a pulled pork plate, a brisket sandwich and a pulled pork sandwich. Aside from one small complaint of a little bit of extra fat in the pork plate serving, everything else was excellent. Didn't notice the fattiness in the pulled pork sandwich I had half of, so I'm guessing it was just a fluke. The half a brisket sandwich was outstanding and the potato with chicken was also very good. Tons of side dish choices too; sure to be something for everyone.

As for the service here, the servers and managers don't appear willing to let anyone get out of there unhappy. They pride themselves on having happy (and most likely return) customers. Just look at their current Yelp rating; that's not easy to do! We had two different managers come over and check on us at two different points during our meal. Our server took great care of us, even hooked my mom up with extra cornbread. Totally made her night. And to all of the guys out there: ice cubes in the urinals when it's time to relieve yourselves. How many places can claim that? ;-)

author: Nikita E.
review text:
I didn't know once I stepped into this dimly lit, vivacious establishment that my life would be changed forever. From the groovy bangers to the tender, well-seasoned meats, Bobby Q has everything you ever wished for in a restaurant.
However, the grandeur of the restaurant does not stop there. After indulging in some moist corn bread, I decided that I wanted a cocktail that would freshen my night up. But there were so many choices in their diverse menu, how could I ever choose? I was set on ordering the Watermelon Cooler, and called over a mysterious waiter, Dylan, to tell him my order. Little did I know his service and demeanor would be the spark in my sudden revelation. Dylan was the amalgamation of Paul Rudd, Chris Pratt, and Chris Evans and quite frankly any other marvel super hero with confidence, bravery, and class. Once I ordered, he respectively gave me his opinion on my drink choice, saying that it was not one of his favorites, and steered me in the right direction with the El Chingo, a smokey, zesty vanilla and cinnamon wonderland. He said that if this drink wasn't for me, he would also give me the cooler with no added charge. Trusting his confident opinion, I went with the Chingo and was blown away by the flavor explosion. From then on our whole dining experience was taken to another level by his helpful comments and playful aura. Our server, Dylan, has sparked some self-reflection in myself that I didn't know I needed. I came to Bobby Q's looking to have a delightful meal with my family, which was easily achieved, but have left this fine establishment with a new outlook on life and humanity.

author: Jennifer S.
review text:
YUM!!! I would recommend this place if you are in the Phoenix area. My co-worker and I heard nothing but good things about it, so we decided to check it out.

Atmosphere: The exterior is quite deceiving. It looks like an old, big shack. The interior is gigantic and cozy. It is clean and organized. There's a pretty bar area, a doughnut station, and lots of tables. They have a separate area with another bar that I think is used for private parties or probably weekend nights. There were some cool decorations on the walls all over the place.

Service: It was great!!! Our server was so knowledgeable. She was friendly and personable, and she had fantastic, flawless makeup! Lol. A manager came by our table to see how we were doing during our meal. It added a nice touch knowing that they cared.

Food: Delicious! Cornbread? Yes! I ordered the grilled shrimp with macaroni and corn. The shrimp was cooked to perfection! And the seasoning was great. It was also great on the corn. I probably could've just eaten corn as a full meal and been happy. Hehehe. The macaroni was delicious, but it was as good as my mother-in-law's. Lol. My co- worker really enjoyed her meal - pulled pork and coleslaw. We split a dessert - the mud pie, and it was good, but we were hoping it'd be on par with the rest of the food. It wasn't, but it didn't take away from the meal. The best was probably the doughnuts!!! They give out free mini doughnuts. They are fresh and sooo wonderful!!! Don't forget them on your way out!

author: Ashley S.
review text:
Just thinking about writing this review is making my mouth water... One of my husband and I's favorite date spots. We always prefer to sit at the bar. I love the warm atmosphere. Makes me feel like I'm in a real BBQ joint somewhere in the South. I have never been here when it's not busy. There is typically a wait, but usually not for the bar. (Pro-tip and part of why we are "Bar People.")As you walk through the front door, you are not only hit with the delicious smell of BBQ, but something else... Cinnamon? YES! Right behind the Hostess stand, you will notice a few of the girls making fresh, home-made, cinnamon and sugar covered donuts. They place them in cute little paper bags and they come with every meal. Even when you think you are so full, you couldn't stuff anything else in your belly... they hand you these melt in your mouth, warm, fresh out of the fryer, donuts. And you will finish them. Trust me.

But let's start at the beginning shall we? Guest's get a complimentary basket of their home made Cornbread after they are sat, always nice, but I try to save as much room as possible for the good stuff. I have never gone to Bobby Q's without first ordering the Q-Rolls to start. The BBQ Version of a Taquito. A white tortilla, filled with Smoked Brisket and served with a chipotle dipping sauce. These little babies are the best "Taquito's" you will ever have in your life. The chipotle sauce is a bit sweet and compliments not only the chipotle but the Brisket very well.

As for dinner, my husband and I always share and rarely come home without a to-go box. Our Favorite dinner to order is the Pick 2 Wood Fired Barbeque Platter. The Sliced Beef Brisket and the Smoked Chicken are my favorites. The Brisket is so tender, you can cut it with your fork. (That goes for any of the meats really. No need for a knife here unless you get a steak.) Drizzled with their House, Home-made BBQ Sauce. Perfectly sweet and tangy. The Chicken with its smoky, smothered in BBQ Goodness its juicy and tender. We have had the ribs, the pulled pork, and the sausage. Pretty much anything under the Platters section of the menu... we have had it, and I have yet to leave feeling unsatisfied. As far as sides go... I don't care what you get as long as you also get the Mac & Cheese. This is a MUST!! So creamy and decedent. It's hard to finish sometimes. The best Mac I have ever tasted.

And there you have it. The best BBQ this side of Phoenix. I dare anyone to say different. Ok... I need to mop up my keyboard now and head to Bobby Q's ASAP. See you there!

author: Robbie G.
review text:
My wife and I stopped at Bobby Q's because we were in that area of town and looking for something tasty for lunch on Yelp. We found this place, which had several stellar reviews, and decided to give it a try.

I got the beef brisket sandwich and my wife got the pulled pork sandwich. I had a side of fries and she got a side of macaroni and cheese. Starting with mine, the beef brisket was amazing. It was well seasoned, they used incredibly soft, super fresh, potato rolls for the buns, and the order came out hot. The french fries were crisp and well seasoned.

The pulled pork that my wife had was good as well, however it was a little on the dry side, and probably could have used some more barbeque sauce. The macaroni and cheese was really good, and some of the creamiest I've ever had. As a starter, they also bring out cornbread which is hot, fresh and soft. It was quite excellent.

For drinks we both got some of their specials. The drinks were massive, well priced at only $10 apiece, and easily big enough to share! Our waiter was Mateo, and he was really friendly and helpful. If he's working, request him. The restaurant itself had a huge outdoor covered seating area with fans and a fountain. There was a nice breeze, and even though it was a hot day it was still comfortable to sit outside. We really enjoyed this place, and would definitely go back.

author: John D.
review text:
A good friend of mine -who's opinion on Q I highly respect- was in town a few months ago and stopped into Bobby Q's (BQ), and he couldn't stop raving about it. I've been jonesing all week to come check it out, but I figured I'd wait until my wife got into town. Well, I finally got my chance and I was giddy as a school girl. I was actually able to make a reservation through OpenTable on the Yelp app, and I'm sure glad we did. Upon our arrival at 5:30 the place was already packed, but by thetime we left at 7 there was a hoard of people flooding out into the street--and for good reason! Enough jibber-jabber--on to the food! I ordered the Three Meat Combo and that comes with two sides and some of BQ's Cornbread.

Sides:

Mac and Cheese- This might easily be the creamiest, most decadent Mac & Cheese I've ever had. They use something similar to Velveeta Cheese to coat it, and I'm not slamming Velveeta. It's so rich I couldn't finish it. 3.75*

Pecan Coleslaw- I'm very picky about my slaw; I don't want it too creamy, sweet, or bitter and this was absolutely perfect! I also loved the crunch you get from the little pieces of toasted Pecan they add to the top--I'm definitely adding that to my slaw the next time I make it. 5*

Cornbread- Excellent mix of a Northern/Southern cornbread--it has the cakiness and slight sweetness if Northern, and the crust and stone-ground corn like a Southern; I could eat these everyday. 5*

Meat:

St. Louis Ribs- These might be the best St. Louis Pork Ribs (other than mine) that I've ever had! The meat had a nice "tug" to it, but was still so tender, smokey and delicious! 5*

Beef Brisket- Juicy and flavorful this brisket was quite good--my only gripe is I wish it had a bit more smokiness to it. 4*

Pulled Pork- Another excellent job by BQ! Juicy, smoky and porky (just like me!) Everything you could want in Pulled Pork and then some. I piggled (sic) the whole lot of it! 5*

Dessert:

Sugar-Cinnamon Donuts- They give everyone at the table these tiny little donuts that they make fresh up front and they're fabulous; they had me at "Cinnamon". I guess you can just walk in and order a dozen for $3 if that's all your craving, too. 5*

Service & Ambiance- Good service from our server, Jessica. She was on top of things without being annoying. BQ is located in a building that looks like something you'd find in the middle of nowhere. The interior is mostly brick and wood causing the noise level in there to be deafening by the end of the night. They also keep it a bit too dark for my liking, but the decor is swell. 4*-service/3.5*-Ambiance

Value- The meals here are not a bad value, as my Three Meat Combo cost $22, but it's more than enough food for 2 people. Even my piggy self couldn't finish it--but guess what's for breakfast?! Snooch to the Nooch! 4*

I'm about to make a bold proclamation: I think BQ has *the* best BBQ I've ever had. I don't make that statement lightly either--after all, I have a reputation to uphold. I think this was easily the best meal I've had here in AZ, and that's saying something. I can't wait for my next visit to the Valley of the Sun so I can visit BQ again. If you ever find yourself in Phoenix, I highly, highly recommend making your way here--just make sure to make a reservation!

author: Nhu N.
review text:
We came here around 6PM on a Tuesday and heard that it was an hour wait. Luckily, we made reservations and did not have to wait at all! Very easy to make reservations over the phone for the same day.

Service was really quick and attentive! I ordered the baby back ribs which included 2 sides. It was delicious! The sauce on the ribs really complimented the taste. Great first experience! Definitely recommend it.

author: Regine A.
review text:
I absolutely love Bobby Q! I've been to Phoenix twice to visit my brother and both times, we've paid a visit here! Their outdoor seating is so cute, especially in the evening when they turn on the light fixtures. What I love is that you can come here for a casual lunch with a friend, come in for a meal with a group/family or for a casual dinner date with your beau. Most dress casual, others put on a cute dress if they're in the mood. Do you!

They're also extremely accommodating. On my second visit, we squeezed in a quick dinner before my flight. We were really TIGHT on time on a Friday night and when we arrived, we needed a table for six [ugh, we're jerks for showing up expecting a table, I know]. Anyways, there was a long list but my brother finagled a little bit and we managed to get seated in within 15 minutes.

There are several items on the menu that I think are worth your money:
- Spinach Artichoke Queso Dip: YUM!!! My brother and I are crazy about this dip. It comes with some damn good garlic toast. Definitely one of my favorite appetizers ever.
- Baby Back Ribs: Can't go wrong with their Baby Backs! They fall right off the bone. *DROOLS*
- Two Meat or Three Meat Combos: This allows you to pick from a variety of options including beef ribs, baby backs, St. Louis, Brisket, Pork, and more!

Can't forget to mention that all of their BBQ platters come with your choice of two sides, sauces and cornbread!

Can't wait to be back in Phoenix so I can have another meal here!

author: Jenny C.
review text:
Bobby Q was our first stop after leaving the airport when we arrived in Phoenix and it left one helluva impression! We came by in the early afternoon on a beautiful Saturday and there was zero wait which is perfect because we were starving. We had the choice of sitting outdoors or indoors but chose the latter because not only was it warm out but I saw customers sitting outside swatting flying bugs.

We ordered the whole hog heaven which is a platter where you choose two ribs, two meats, and three sides for $48. With the help of our waitress we decided to go with the baby backs and beef ribs, brisket and sausage for the meats, and the mac & cheese, ranch beans, and the shoestring fries for the sides. While we were waiting, we received complimentary cornbread. Moist, fluffy, buttery, and semi-sweet... these cornbreads were the best I've ever had! I'm sure they are SO bad for your health though but I could only live in the moment!

- Baby back ribs: May sound like a boring choice but nope. These were smoked to perfection and the meat fell off the bone. I was very impressed.
- Beef ribs: If I had to pick a favorite meat of the meal, the beef ribs would be it. These are finger-licking good with loads of meat, and even some bone marrow too. Just divine. Absolutely to die for. LOVE!
- Brisket: The first bite I had of the fatty brisket sent me to meat heaven. Succulent and explosive in taste. The leaner parts of the brisket was a touch dry and needed some extra barbecue sauce to fix that though.
- Sausage: Robust in flavor with a nice peppery kick.
- Mac & cheese: I'm not usually a fan of mac & cheese but these are great. I ate spoonfuls after spoonfuls.
- Ranch beans: Smoky and savory. Love these beans. Again, best I've had. My favorite of the three sides!
- Shoestring fries: I'm generally prefer thick-cut fries but these were an exception. Impeccably fried and perfectly salted, these were very tasty and fun to pick at. Simple yet awesome.

After our incredibly satisfying feast (yes, we had leftovers for the next day!), we were given freshly fried cinnamon sugar doughnuts on our way out. They were amazing! OMG! The first bite of everything at Bobby Q was seriously like a party in my mouth. Every. Single. Thing. From start to finish.

I LOVE BOBBY BBQ! PLEASE COME TO NEW YORK!

author: Santo G.
review text:
Excellent food and atmosphere. The weather was perfect for lunch outside and the lunch menu was fairly priced. I got the sampler to try all of the best BBQ. The brisket was a little dry but the ribs were to die for! I will be back again hopefully soon. I will get a full rack of ribs for my entire meal though. Juicy, fall of the bone, perfect smoky flavor. You can tell Bobby Q's knows what they're talking about when it comes to the ribs.

I can tell this is something I will be craving again.

author: Alana E.
review text: This is my favorite BBQ place! Better then BBQ in Austin.  The brisket melts in your mouth and the bark is yummy and salty.  To die for! We will be going back for sure when we visit again for next year's baseball spring training! The chicken and sausage were good too.  I really liked the corn. They give you free corn bread while you wait. Austin was a great server.  He made sure we had everything we need and our cups were filled at all times.

author: Kai A.
review text: One of the best ribs and brisket I had. The rib meat could have fallen right off but it was just right- juicy and flavorful . The brisket was flavorful but could have been less dry. Overall top 3 ( I've been to a couple in Austin and Houston) and this one made it on that list. The meal comes w one side ( Mac and cheese- a little too cheesy for me tbh) and corn bread (could be warm. Order the sweet tea and call it a day!

author: Maria P.
review text: Bobby Q was really good! From their food to their service everything was great. We started off with their famous cornbread which was so good with that butter! For my main entree I ordered the beef brisket and 1/2 rack St. Louis style ribs which was so tender and juicy. I had a side of mac n' cheese and the potato salad which complemented the meal very well. My guest ordered the triple meat combo which included pulled pork, ribs and brisket with sides of the pecan coleslaw and baked potato. Everything was honestly really good and I would recommend this place to anyone who enjoys a true barbecue experience! I also enjoyed the cute mini donuts they gave for dessert. I would also like to note that we had plenty of leftovers which was awesome!

author: Kirke R.
review text:
I have wanted to try Bobby Q for years and finally had the opportunity with some friends. It's a really good place for BBQ!

I made a reservation (they get an extra shout out for being on Open Table) and it's a good thing I did. 6:15 on a Wednesday and the place was packed and many people waiting to be seated. We were promptly seated thanks to my reservation.

Our server came by to take our drink order and asked if we wanted any appetizers. Knowing what we would most likely be in for food wise, we skipped the appetizers and went right to dinner.

To drink I ordered sweet iced tea. $2.00 I love this stuff and order it wherever, whenever I can!  

Though we skipped the appetizers, we did order salads which were really great, $5.50. Ranch house salad, my favorite type anywhere. Crisp lettuce, cheese, tomato, red onion and ranch dressing. Simple and delicious!

My friends split the Whole Hog Heaven platter. They could choose two kinds of ribs, two meats and three sides. They ended up ordering double ribs and double brisket. There was so much food that four people could have easily split it. $48.00

Being a prime rib fan, I had to go for it. I ordered the smoked 10oz slab $26.00. It was outstanding! I was a little afraid the smoked flavor would overpower the meat...Not at all. It was just right. My entree came with two sides so I had mac and cheese and potato salad. Both outstanding!

Dessert was tempting as mud pie was available which I would normally go for. There just wasn't room after all that food! We did however receive a complimentary bag of mini doughnuts. Served hot and dusted with cinnamon and sugar. Delicious and just right. You can take those home if you want.

Everything about our evening at Bobby Q was outstanding. We were taken very good care of by our server and management checked on us a couple of times. Special shout out to one of the managers on duty Donnie. He was very friendly and went above and beyond to make sure we were enjoying our evening. Nice touch!

Be sure to try Bobby Q! It won't disappoint! Look for the Mesa location opening soon!

Enjoy!

author: Jenny H.
review text:
Sooo glad we got a chance to try Bobby Q while visiting Arizona!

First and foremost, their service was incredible. I called in 45 minutes before and booked a reservation for Sunday night. Upon arrival, they greeted us warmly and seated us right away at a comfortable booth. Hunter, our server, was awesome. He was super friendly and helped us make our dinner choices.

My boyfriend and I shared the Wedge Salad and the 3 Meat Combo - St. Louis Ribs, Baby Back Ribs, and the Brisket. The Wedge Salad was really fresh and refreshing (but not the healthiest since it comes with a pile of fried onions, but I'm not complaining!) All the meats were fall-off-the-bone tender and the bbq sauce was on point. For the sides we had the Baked Beans which were perfectly sweet, and the Mac n Cheese which I could probably have done without but it was okay.

I couldn't have been happier with the meal and service but then they come with a bag of HOT FRESH donuts on the house. Wow...talk about cherry on top. You guys definitely made my night! 5 stars all the way!

author: KJ S.
review text: I have been coming to this please for years. They come every year for my birthday dinner with my family, and every year it is the same! We love this place and will always come back. This is by far the best barbeque you will ever find in Arizona through and through. The macaroni and cheese is heaven the cornbread is amazing the chicken, the fried chicken is out of this world! The barbeque pulled pork  is my all-time favourite and the perfect burger is exactly that! Just perfect! Order q rolls as an appetizer and the pineapple drink if you need a cocktail and please thank me later LOL!

author: Jeff I.
review text:
My, oh my! Every once in a while you stumble across a gem when you're in another city. This gem was located right across the 17 freeway from our hotel in Phoenix

Saw this places' sign from the freeway and it looked intriguing. Not much on sweet style bbq sauce or brisket because I'm biased  (Raised on Eastern North Carolina style chopped pork) but this place was off the hook!

Walked in the door and told there was a 1 hour wait so we decided to wait. Found a spot at the bar so we decided against waiting and ordered our food from there. We started off with these apps they call Q-Rolls and they claim they're "World famous". Well, they deserve that title as far as I'm concerned. Bbq brisket rolled in pastry shells like taquitos with chipotle and bbq sauce for dipping. Mercy!!

For my entree, I had the St. Louis and baby back ribs with roasted corn and tater salad. The meat was super tender and falling off the bone. The waiter offered to bring
me more sauce but it was super delicious just the way it was. Not a big fan of tater salad but this was great so I'm a fan of theirs.

My wife had the fried catfish and same sides as me and she was well satisfied, She really don't like Bbq but she liked the taste of mine a lot.

DERN!!! I forgot to mention the cornbread! This is what bbq should be served with. Last, we finished up with the bread pudding. My wife said this was the best she ever had so that's saying something, Bread pudding is her favorite dessert and she never likes anybodys but her own.

This place was not completely laid back with paper towels and checkered table cloths but they weren't over-the-top fancy either. To me, a great place to drink a beer and bust the buttons on your britches.

author: Sunshine M.
review text:
Went here for an impromptu dinner. We were going to get dinner with M's parents and we wanted meat so we decided to go here. We have seen this place for years driving by and now we finally decided to try it. The patio was soooo pretty they had string lights everywhere. I love the ambiance. The inside was pretty too, but we kinda got stuck in a corner near a sink? I would have probably preferred the patio.

The service was great, and the food came out fast. The server welcomed us first timers very well, and talked about the awards the restaurant was won which was pretty cool.

We decided to split a three meat plate and an extra side: baby back ribs, pulled pork, brisket with mashed potatoes, ranch beans, and macncheese.

The meat were very tender and the bbq sauce was good, I added a little bit of the spicy bbq sauce (not really that spicy tho). I felt like the bbq was soft and tender but it was also a little bland? I don't know maybe there was too much hype on this place that I set the bar in my mind so high? It was good but I thought it would be so much better. The sides were pretty good too especially the mac n cheese. Oh and I ordered the frozen lemonade which was nice (wasn't too sweet), felt like I was drinking a margarita ;)

Everyone else did enjoy the meal very much...maybe it's just my taste buds..hmmm...well I'd def come back for more to try it more...

Ooh the bread was sooo good yumm!

3.5stars for me for now

author: Adam O.
review text: Went on a Saturday with some friends, was a 2 hour wait to dine in (make a reservation!) But for take out once we ordered we got our food pretty dang quick, within 10-15 minutes. I got the Texas beef ribs with the pecan coleslaw and mac and cheese and the apple cobbler for desert. The ribs were really good, juicy and super flavorful. Coleslaw was tasty but not outstanding, the mac and cheese was amazing though. The desert was disappointing though unfortunately and just okay. Each order comes with cornbread that was hot and fresh and really tasty, just wish I had some cranberry sauce with it! Will definitely come back.

author: Colleen F.
review text:
The ambiance.....i cant say enough about the fantastic feel this place has. It has a rustic look with upscale charm. I sat on the patio and was nervous the noise of the expressway would annoy me. That exact opposite happened. The fountain with the trickling water and the ebb and flow of cars combined to make me feel peaceful and relaxed. The place is incredibly clean as well.

For the meal itself I ordered Q-rolls to start. These were like beef brisket meeting an egg roll.  It was served with a chipotle sauce and bbq sauce. It was easy to eat and very tasty. The crispy dough outer shell complimented the flavor in the beef.

For dinner i ordered the 2 choice option. Beef brisket, of course, and the baby back ribs because sever said they'd be one of the best i would ever had.   To be honest, i have had better beef brisket in Tennessee. By all means it was excellent but a tad dry compared to some of the juicy fatty brisket from those hillybilly towns off the  main roads. The server did not lie about the baby back ribs. My grandmother's ribs compete with these and that says a lot to the quality and taste. WOW!!!!!!  Wonderful!!!!!  I also ordered the ranch baked beans. Very flavorful. It has beef and pork in them. Some of the meat was stringy so texture was odd but flavor is great.

As for the service.....OUTSTANDING!!!!!  Hunter was my server and his knowledge of the menu and ability to give tips enhanced my experience. He was friendly and had just the right amount of chattiness. The manager, Cameron, was also extremely attentive. I felt like i was in the fine dining section of a cruise ship. They both teamed up to make sure everything was perfect throughout the night.

I look forward to returning here to try more of their fabulous menu items!!!!

Ps. They due brew their own beer. Tastes like a shiner bock with less after taste.

author: Jennifer S.
review text: Ordered the Thanksgiving meal for 3-4 people for $75.  Came with grilled corn,  creamy mashed red potatoes, gravy and corn bread.  Wasn't the best meal I had but def would order this again.  Loved smoked turkey for a change than the traditional oven-baked Turkey.

author: Kelly G.
review text:
I'm not crazy about BBQ so my review might be slightly biased.

I got brisket because it seemed to be the most crazed about meat. I could see why people love it but it was just decent to me. Very tender but typical BBQ flavor.

Mac and cheese tasted like what I've had at other BBQ restaurants but a bit better. Same with the corn bread.

I got it for take-out and they were extremely quick so that was much appreciated!

author: Tim S.
review text:
My friend Kate M. had mentioned that she had wanted to have lunch here sometime.  Today, the stars aligned and we (wife and son) drove down here to meet Kate and her husband for a late lunch.  This place has always piqued my interest, and honestly, I'm not sure why I never had lunch/dinner here before.  We drove down and met them at 2pm.

Kate and her husband were already there and grabbed us a table and high chair for our son Bill.  They had ordered Some Q-Rolls (basically an egg roll stuffed with smoked brisket) and some drinks already and offered me up a Q-Roll.  These things were good!  They serve them with chipotle and a bbq sauce.  I could definitely see myself eating a whole order of these things.  

I had read some reviews of this place and it sounded like most people enjoyed the ribs.  Who doesn't like ribs?  I decided to go with the 2 Rib Combo (St. Louis and baby back) which came with 2 sides.  I chose ranch beans and french fries for my sides.  Had a Diet Pepsi to drink.  My wife ordered a brisket sandwich and some mac and cheese for her side.  Pretty much ordered the fries and mac and cheese for our son.  You will have to read Kates review about what she and her husband ordered ;-).  Before they bring out your food, they give you a basket of cornbread.  This stuff was great!  I ate 2 pieces of it and could have ate more.  Anyways....on to the main dishes.  Here is how everything was...............

Rib Combo-  Delicious!  These ribs were so tender they fell off the bone.  I know some BBQ purists will say that ribs should not fall off the bone, but I don't give a shit...these ribs were delicious!  I ate the baby backs first.  They were awesome!  They came covered in minimal sauce so the meat really stood out.  I dug straight in with my hands and would just pick pieces of meat off the bone and savor every bite.  They were delicious and I can see why so many people order them here.  After the baby backs, I got into the St. Louis style ribs.  These were not as good as the baby backs, but they were still pretty damn tasty.  They were cooked so well, that even up at the cartilage portion, there was minimal of it and you could pick through and get every single little morsel of meat.  All that was left on the plate was pretty much bones and a few pieces of cartilage.  These ribs were 5 star ribs!

Sides-  This is where I was a little let down.  I love, love, love some good beans.  I prefer some baked beans, lots of sauce, cooked well done so they are thick, and lots of scraps of meat throughout.  These beans had some meat in them, but they were "ranch style" beans and just alright....a little runny.  The sauce was good enough to hold them together, but I have had much better beans elsewhere and would not get these again.  The portion was skimp too!  It was like 5 spoonfuls worth.  The fries were really thin shoestring fries.  They were pretty good.  My son loved them...he loves pretty much any french fry.  They are his favorite food, by far!  The problem with really thin shoestring fries is that they tend to get hard/cold fast.  They were still pretty good though and I would get them as a side again.  Really big portion of them, too!

My wife gave me a piece of her brisket from her sandwich.  It was legit.  She thought that her brisket sandwich was a little bit too plain/boring though.  The side of mac and cheese was good.  Really cheesy, Velveeta type mac and cheese.  Decent portion size too.  Not sure why the beans were such a skimp portion.  Everything else was hooked up!  Oh yeah..when you are done with your meal they provide you with some free mini donuts.  A bit skimp (3 tiny donuts for 3 people), but free so I can't complain.  They tasted like a lemon pound cake, deep fried and then rolled in sugar.  I could mow down a dozen!  They were delicious!  I just wish they maybe gave you 3 per person...then we would be talking!

Service was great!  They had multiple people servicing our table throughout the whole meal and everyone was on point!  I think even the manager came by to ask how everything was.  Conversation was great, too.  It was the first time Kate and her husband met my wife and son.  A good time was had by all!

Will I be back?  Yes, at some point for sure.  The ribs were absolutely fantastic, and with the right choice of sides, this is a damn fine BBQ meal and a potential 5 star joint!  It wasn't the cheapest lunch ($63.00 after tax/tip), but for my first time here, the amount of food,  and the people I was with, it was worth it!   I'm sure I will be back before too long.

author: Alison K.
review text: I really enjoyed this restaurant! We went here for a group dinner and it was a bit loud and hard to hear everyone at the table, but the food was amazing! I thought the brisket was one of the best I've ever had, if not THE best. It was so juicy and tender and very flavorful. Also, the baby back ribs were also to die for. They give you corn bread to start that is super delicious and end with FRESH mini donuts that were just fried. I can't wait to go back!

author: Dan F.
review text: Rated as one of top 30 barbecue restaurants in the US. Came here at 4:30pm on Saturday but almost full tables. Old style machine for donuts at the entrance with hot donuts boiling and it's free. Ordered onion block, while baby back ribs and 5 jumbo shrimps. The ribs are super tender and juicy, really yummy. Enjoyed the dinner. Too full so have to walk before going back.

author: Scott R.
review text:
Food was delicious. Second time coming here when visiting Phoenix. Corn bread they start the meal off with is delicious.

The decor is great. A lot of effort went into it to make it look so nice inside.

Would have gave it 5 stars but took about 30 minutes to get good out. Bbq never should take that long to serve.

Meal was great and desert was even better. Service was good too.

Mini donuts at end of meal are the best.

author: Elizabeth N.
review text:
Definitely a huge fan. I absolutely love the ambience and setup. Their service was fast and amazing. They serve tea that comes in these cute little boxes and they give you a select variety. They also give you home made cornbread with butter.

I ordered the two meat platter which came with two sides. I ordered pulled pork and the baby back ribs. The ribs were probably the best I have tasted. I balanced the meal out with their grilled veggies and Mac and cheese on the side. Needless to say I was in the clean plate brigade that night.

For dessert, you really need to try the mud pie. Very generous portion to either share or just feed that sweet tooth for yourself.

Overall I'm definitely a fan :) :)

author: Elisha G.
review text:
So I just recently moved to Phoenix from Indy and after a day of shopping a friend suggested that we go get some BBQ, I'm not one that usually seeks out BBQ so I gave her a meh, but went along anyway and I'm glad I did.

If I were a bride at the altar and I was told I could never have Bobby Q ever again if I married the man in front of him I'd have to think twice before saying those vows as I'd question the sanity and ill intent of the Benedict Arnold standing before me. In short THIS PLACE IS FRIGGEN AWESOME!!!

I was able to get a 3 meat platter for $25.00 and stingy is not something that resides in this place's vocabulary. I got more on one plate than I could for $25.00 at the grocery store and when they sat the behemoth of a plate before me I was full before I took a bite. The meat slides off the bone so you will need a fork...and a bib...and a belt extender. The flavor was fantastic from the sauce, to the meat, to the macaroni, to the corn bread, to the napkins, and to the free doughnuts after. The staff is super quick and friendly! I took food home and was really sad when the last of it was gone... So here I am here again on my second of what will be a lifetime of trips leaving a review as I wait to be seated, question is why are you still reading this and not here yet?  :-)

author: Sandra S.
review text:
We came to Bobby Q off of the recommendation of a friend and we were definitely not disappointed! The food was super good, the service was great, and the restaurant looked very clean and nice.

We came at around 12pm and there wasn't a line, and we were seated at a large table. The waitresses were very nice, and brought us water once we sat down. We saw the fresh mini donuts being made near the front of the door and they kindly gave us some before our meal; the donuts were dusted with cinnamon sugar and they were delicious! The donuts were soft, warm, and perfectly fried. After the donuts, we decided on the Whole Hog, which was quite a lot of food for three girls. The whole hog came with St. Louis and Baby Back Ribs, three sides (which we ordered shoe string fries, mashed potatoes, and corn), BBQ chicken, and brisket, as well as cornbread. The cornbread was buttery and delicious, and it tasted great with the whipped butter. The bbq was honestly the best I have yet to have! The meat was fall-off-the-bone tender, and the meat had a good fat-to-meat ratio. Of the meats, my favorite was the smokey St. Louis ribs, which were less saucy and contained chewy tendons (if you're into that like I am). The mashed potatoes was also super buttery and smooth, and tasted almost like a dip. Also, the waitress brought two pitchers of BBQ sauce, one spicy and one original, so be prepared to drench all the meat in even more sauce.

After the meal, the waitress was super kind and brought us another round of donuts!

I would highly recommend this place if you're in Phoenix! The food was amazing, the staff was super friendly, and the sides and donuts make this place stand out.

author: Marc H.
review text:
Great BBQ joint in Phoenix! Such a good experience!

This place seemed like it was in a random location/nothing around the area, but maybe that's just because it was dark out and we were just trying to find the restaurant. The parking lot is large to accommodate all the people they likely have every night.  

We were greeted and seated immediately. Inside the ambiance was pretty loud and fun. Lots of space and seating, so groups are great here. When you walk in, you also might notice the doughnut making machine on the right. Try to save some room for those at the end! They're pretty good, and you get them complimentary!

The service overall was good, fast and friendly. No complaints at all.

The food was really good as well! We got the Whole Hog Heaven. For two people, we really didn't come close to finishing this, so this might be good for three people, or four with smaller appetites. The meat was all delicious! I thought the brisket and pulled pork was a touch on the dry side, but I just threw some more sauce on and all was good. The cornbread is lite and fluffy, and the sides were great. Of all the meats, I actually thought the St Louis Ribs had the most flavor. And then, there was the doughnuts! Cinnamon Sugar I think. I don't think I have ever seen something like this given out complimentary before! What a nice touch!

Overall, great bbq spot in Phoenix! Highly recommend this place!

author: Barb M.
review text:
Sorry Yelpers!  This is not my first time here but the second!  Well if we count the take out my husband brought home Sunday than this is my 3rd.  Everything we have ordered here is fabulous!  On Sunday my husband got the 3 meat meal & I the loaded baked potato with brisket.  The brisket on my potato was Melt in your mouth yummy goodness!  Now I had to fast one of the hubby's St Louis ribs.  Oh my goodness - I was sad we didn't get a rack of those for my dessert.  It was soooo good!!!

So 3 days later I am here for the ribs & that Mac n cheese. I am trying the Cajun shrimp as a starter which I always get the onion block.  Maybe new favorites to unveil today! Will be continued....

author: Patricia S.
review text: This is our new brisket Q place. Oh my, so delicious!  We've tried several dishes and so far everything is so tasty that I can't pick a favorite yet:) this is my date night with the honey, and those craft beers are great. I love the big blue van..hope they bring on blue moon on draft soon.

author: Howard H.
review text:
I had a two hour layover coming from Austin, TX through PHX and onto San Francisco.  I knew I would be cutting it close, but I jumped in an Uber and hightailed it over to Bobby Q.  The I-10 shooter couldn't even stop me from getting to my barbecue beef ribs and buying chef Mark H. a drink.  I was greeted by a lovely hostess and waitress named Jessica.  I got seated at a large booth, ordered a drink, and my beef ribs.  The drink and food appeared quickly.  The Bobby Q experience is simply the best.  The whole staff is just plain awesome.  Various people came by to bus plates, ask how I was doing, and see if there was anything they could help me with.  It was a great meal with some serious cornbread and mini-doughnut dessert.  I LOVE PEOPLE FROM PHOENIX AND I LOVE COMING TO BOBBY Q!

Unfortunately, chef Mark was not there, but I did make my flight home.  Chef Mark, if you read this, "I owe you a drink."

author: Jennifer K.
review text: Drove from Las Vegas to Phoenix to catch a concert. My sister and I wanted a good meal before we headed out of town and saw this place on Yelp. We were a little concerned with the area but we are so glad we decided to stop and eat here. The atmosphere was amazing. Sat on the patio and it was comfortable and had a ton of character. The food was delicious and really reasonably priced. The service was as great! I totally recommend this place!

author: Gabriel G.
review text:
I would give 6 stars if I could. This place has it all! The food, the service, and the atmosphere is always on point. I've never had a problem in all of my visits here.

-The Service
My first time at Bobby Q, the Server greeted us (My Girlfriend and I) with an awesome attitude. She explained that their signature ribs are smoked for 22 hours, and a brief history about the company. There's usually a Manager circling around to make sure everyone is satisfied.

-The Food
My Girlfriend and I always order the 2 Rib Combo, I get the St. Louis Style, She gets the Baby Back. Believe me when I say, the meat literally and I mean literally falls off the bone with no effort at all! The sauce tastes amazing and they're not stingy with it. One of the highlights is the cornbread. Now, if you know me at all, I used to hate cornbread. But Bobby Q has changed my mind. The cornbread is very tasty and you can actually taste the real corn.

-Atmosphere
Kinda gives you a feel of an indoor picnic. They have unique seating. I personally like seating in the booths facing the TVs at the Bar. They usually have sports games on (NFL, MLB, NBA etc...) I believe at a certain time, it changes into a Night Club, which I have yet to try. I haven't tried their drinks yet, but I'm looking forward to it.

I would recommend Bobby Q to anyone I know. No matter how busy they are, they make sure their customers are happy. And they do get pretty busy. That's expected with the amazing food and service they have. Kudos to the Owner and Managers. And thank you to the wonderful staff! I'll definitely be back! - Gabriel Salazar

author: Jason G.
review text: The restaurant was packed and even though there was a wait list we got seated right away.  However, we had to wait at our table a really long time and I think they forgot about us but the waiter apologized and gave us a free appetizer.  In terms of the food - appetizer 4, baby backs 5, spare ribs 5, chicken 4, sausage 3, mac and cheese 4, roasted corn 5, corn bread 4, potato salad 4, cinnamon sugar donuts 4.  Overall, really excellent barbecue.

author: Adam T.
review text:
In town for a few days so I decided to check out this highly rated BBQ place. Killer environment and great service!

I really enjoyed my brisket plate with mac n cheese, Brisket didn't have too much fat and had great smoke rings. Mac n cheese was homemade and super fresh.

Finished it off with complimentary dessert donuts! I'll definitely come back to this place!

author: Mary W.
review text:
Let me start by saying I wish I could give it zero stars. Owners/managers are racist, racist, racist!!  It is blatantly obvious that their "dress code" in the lounge is not dependent on what you're wearing but what color your skin is. If you are African American take your money and patronage elsewhere and save yourself the frustration and harassment.
We have been here dozens of times over the years and have spent thousands of dollars but we're done!!  Their practice is unacceptable. Shame on them!

author: Thomas L.
review text:
I consider myself a BBQ connoisseur, traveled to many places in search of some of the best BBQ places, I know Texas, Kansas City, Memphis, and North Carolina are the BBQ capitals of the US.  I would say Bobby Q's is more like Kansas City style than anything else.  They drown the sauce all over the meats, in which hides the true flavors of the smoked meats.  I have heard about this place many times, and finally gave it a try since my co-worker raved about this place, and said it was voted as one of the best in AZ.  In which, I respectfully disagree BIG TIME.  That honor would go to Little Miss BBQ in Phoenix.  I would say even Rudy's, Joe's, and Famous Dave's is far superior.  So let's get into my review.

I came to this place on a Saturday afternoon with my wife and my brother.  We noticed the building off the I-17, it felt older and had a BBQ smell about it, in which I enjoyed.  The dining room was dark and  had an older feel to it.  We decided to sit outside.  One thing that I did notice is the chairs are very old and falling apart.  I had to move some chairs around cause a few of them had BBQ stains on them.  Anyways, I'm at a BBQ joint, so I don't let that stuff bother me, it's almost to be expected.  We ordered the Hog Heaven and fried chicken dish.  The Hog Heaven consisted of half a rack of spare ribs, 2 beef ribs, some pulled pork, and prime brisket.  It also came with 3 sides in which we ordered shoe string potatoes, mac and cheese and a baked potato.  There was also corn bread for the table.  My wife enjoyed her fried chicken dish, but thought the sides were a little bland and mashed potatoes could of used more butter and salt.  My experience  with the Hog Heaven was just ok.  When enjoying BBQ, I normally don't like ribs completely falling off the bone, and the pulled pork was completely doused with sauce, and the brisket was extremely tender.  I'm not trying to be a BBQ snob, but I like "competition style" BBQ.  Ribs should be tender, but hold up.  You should be able to take a bite and not completely fall off the bone, and the same with brisket.  It should be able to pull it apart and be tender and moist on the pallet.  The brisket completely fell apart and was too covered with too much BBQ sauce.  We were served two beef ribs, but one barely had any meat on it, (See Picture).  For 50.00 for the Hog Heaven, I truly didn't feel it was worth the price.  The sides were ok, but how hard is it to screw up fries, and a baked potato.  The mac and cheese was good though.  Overall, our experience was ok, nothing to rave about, but I'm glad I had a chance to experience Bobby Q and see what all the fuss was about.

In conclusion, I'm more of a sauce on the side kind of guy.  I truly enjoy BBQ and enjoy the smoked flavor and the tenderness of the meats.  The sauce should be on the side and help accentuate the meat, not completely covering the meats.  Why smoke BBQ for 6 to 15 hours if you are just going to ruin the flavor?  In the area, there aren't a lot of great BBQ places, but I would give this place another shot, I would just order the sauce on the side.  I love's Joe BBQ in gilbert, but I've had a bad experience, where the meat was a little dry, so I would give this a try again.

author: James E.
review text: First visit here as I was looking for a decent BBQ experience.   I have to say this was far better than entry level decent!   The food exceeded my expectations as did the wonderful service provided by Leigh Ann (sp) I highly recommended "The Whole Hog", a varietal feast for two!  The baby back ribs melted off the bone!  Mac & Cheese tasty as was the seasoned roasted corn. This place is worthy of future visits with more friends in tow!

author: Mike H.
review text:
Just had lunch here for the first time. It was excellent!
It was an hour drive for me but worth every minute.
Service was fast & friendly. Chelsea took excellent care of this first timer. I ordered the two rib combo with baby back & St.Louis. My sides were beans and pecan Cole slaw. Everything was hot and fresh. The meaty ribs did fall off the bone. I was licking my fingers after the couple of bites. I like it when a manager stops at your table to make sure everything is ok, nice touch. A little spendy but you get what you pay for and in my case it was actually 2 meals. I feel sorry for the other bbq places in the valley that I thought were good...Bobby Q kills 'em.

author: Sahsa M.
review text:
On a business trip and was craving prim rib. Yelp reviews took me to this place for the first time. I had the prim rib with baked potato and corn. The food was very good and the fresh homemade lemonade made it even better!
The girl who served my table ( Monique)was very nice and she made a great suggestions on food.
They also have them insane donuts that they made fresh and they were so good
If I come back to Phoenix anytime I'll make sure I eat at this place at least once !
Thank you all the people at Bobby Q!

author: Millie H.
review text:
My husband had introduced me to this place and asked me "Hun, wanna go try out this place called Bobby Q?" and me, what? you mean "BBQ" and he says "No, its called Bobby Q" and were going back and forth with the correction of the name he's getting irritated with me and I'm getting irritated with him of his spelling! But, as we pull up and I see the sign it literally is called "Bobby Q" I got gonged!" hahahahaha and apologized!

This is the first place that I really enjoyed having some delicous BBQ style dishes. I've had before in Mesa at another place and that was great too because we ate it as family style. But, this is probably one of my favorite places in the valley of having some good ole' BBQ dishes with the macaroni cheese, yummy corn bread, baked bbq beans, coleslaw and their delicious sweet tea, which is something that I haven't really had before but, all was amazing.
I love as we were coming up to the restaurant you can almost smell the slow roasting smell through your car which gets you excited and more hungry as you park. I love the barn look and the atmosphere and everyone in here is so nice!
You really feel like you are in another state and the food it's so picture perfect that my family/friends back home their mouths are dropping because we don't have this back home an if we do, it is not the same.
The q-rolls with the brisket is one of my favorite appetizers to get and I heard it's something new they just added to their menu. I've never was fond of brisket because it always tasted so dry, but, Bobby Q's its amazing. The brisket is so juicy, slow roasted for at least 18-24 hrs daily, and taste of the bbq on it is simply just delicious! All their meats are soon tasty, I don't need to go to one of those fine dining restaurants anymore, I just rather be comfortable and enjoy their combo dishes or the HOG HAVEN and bring home the left overs to salivate later for next days lunch or dinner....

They also have these amazing donuts with cinnamon on it, to me it almost could pass for "Malasada's" its a portugese delicatessen desert dish...Same concept! Was soon ono! Happy place- Amazing food, customer service, and ambiance!

author: Serafina R.
review text:
Started off with us asking where our waiter was...and after that, service was impeccable. The manager came to our table, apologized and comped us dessert. Our server was great with recommendations, came to our table often and again request was readily filled. Definitely decided this is our new dine in spot. Best bbq. Soft, succulent, savory meat.

Side note. Got a doggie bag worth of treats on the way out. #NewFavoritePlace

author: Konlee S.
review text: So i luv this place n its great food n today i checked in on yelp n showed it to my server Linzy n she marked it off on my app but i realized when i got home n looked at the bill closer n my 10% off was not applied to my bill this is upsetting because my bill was $141.78 so it wasn't a cheap meal we had... its to late im home n but this is very upsetting! Overall aside from this issue our meal was great portions service by Linzy was good she kept coming by to make sure we were good n drinks were always filled. Lesson for today is look closely at ur bill b4 signing it.

author: Linda M.
review text: A great place for never-fail barbecue. Prompt friendly service. Charming patio, vast inside dining space.

author: Brett B.
review text:
Came here on a whim, and fell in love with the place.

Our server Raymond was super friendly and commented repeatedly on how they Love Yelp here.  Hey Gabi, this would be a great place for an official Elite Event, and they have an attached nightclub!

On to the food.  Ray suggested the Q-Rolls appetizer, and it didn't disappoint.  They're like flautas made with brisket, accompanied by two dipping sauces.  Simply Amazing!

Ray also recommended the whole hog entree with brisket, pulled-pork and baby backs.  It was large enough for my wife and I to share.  Delicious and filling.  My daughter ordered the half chicken plate, and their fries are superb.

We finished it off with a peach cobbler, and to our surprise, we were presented with a bag of Thank-Q's (accompanying our check), which were freshly made dough balls coated in cinnamon & sugar.  Very good!

If we lived closer, we'd be a fixture in this place.

author: Katie D.
review text:
I took a long hiatus from yelping and now I'm back with a vengeance!  See the great thing about yelp and people actually taking the time to write reviews is how I came across Bobby Qs in a recent road trip to Az.  

Hands down the most decadent, tender, fall of the bone, flavor packed ribs I've ever had.  Second favorite was a tie between the brisket and sausage.  Got one of the meat combos and basically everything was on point and memorable.  Service was excellent--very attentive, drinks and water glass were never empty.  

Easily 5 stars in my book!

Keep on BBQing, Bobby Q!

author: Alexander C.
review text:
Anytime is a good time for barbecue. The smell of burning wood, the sweet thick or vinegary sauces and meat that just fall off the bone -- these elements have mass appeal to my senses.

So it's probably no surprise that I've been to most Valley smokehouses to check out their goods.

My latest exploration, Bobby-Q, came after a day of bargain hunting at a clearance outlet at Metrocenter. So much shopping can work up an appetite, and you'll need an appetite since the prices at Bobby-Q are low and the portions are large.

The location might be familiar to many longtime Phoenicians -- it was Bobby McGee's until about five years ago. I have many fond memories eating there with my family as a kid.

While the building got a $3 million dollar makeover, the charm and coziness is intact. It's sort of a cowboy chic with dim lighting, stained concrete floors and a tin ceiling. The seating is comfortable and the service friendly and efficient. If you're in a hurry, you can call ahead; there is a separate entrance for to-go orders.

Everything on the menu is made in house, from the barbecue sauce to the fluffy corn bread. Being an avid home cook I can appreciate these extra steps.

Always wanting to try something new, the Q-Rolls ($7.50) are a take on a Mexican flauta. Filled and rolled with smoked beef brisket and then deep-fried to a golden brown, these looked better than they tasted. The roll's open ends allowed for far too much oil to penetrate the meaty interior, which ended up a tasteless crunch.

A steakhouse classic, the Wedge Salad ($5), is made with a quarter of crisp head lettuce, sprinkled with smoked bacon, chopped tomatoes and bleu cheese crumbles. I can never resist the power of blue cheese and bacon.

The menu includes entree-sized salads, sandwiches and steaks, but my focus was on smoked meats. You can order two or three meat platters, but I opted for the Whole Hog ($36), a choice of two ribs, two meats and three sides.

When the plate arrived, my eyes widened. Huge slabs of Baby Back Ribs and St. Louis-Style Ribs were framed by piles of pulled pork and beef brisket, it's quite the mother lode of meat, so be prepared to share with others.

Going straight to the ribs, I grabbed a bone and it immediately separated from the rib meat. The meat was melt-in-your -mouth tender, and rightly so; they cook their meats low and slow for about 20 hours.

With all of the meat loving going on, it's easy to forget the sides. The Mac 'n Cheese was creamy and gooey and was worth ordering again. Pecan Cole Slaw was good, but I especially liked the toasted pecans, hich provided a nice contrast. Roasted Corn comes topped with a few wheels of corn on the cob. I wish the entire dish were served this way, since the kernels were swimming in a pool of butter.

After finishing this feast, there couldn't possibly be room for Peach Cobbler ($6.50) or Mud Pie ($6.50). But it was a nice touch that the check was brought out with a small bag of hot fresh cinnamon and sugar-covered donuts.

author: Mark F.
review text:
A roadtrip would not be complete without local BBQ and Bobby's does not disappoint!

Fancy smancy table service
Dark and cool with bar seating
Rotisserie chick and bragging about the ribs. Alex was friendly and rattled off drink specials. Other servers were chatting with friends at the bar and one, blond one dipped into her cleavage for something. I hope she washes her hands before serving up a meal. Now I look around, this is a breaking ground for hooters. Low cut and falling out. Not a fan of that.
Bobby Q Amber Ale (Sonoran Brewing) is too light with a bitter bite. Not my type of amber but they tried.
2 meats, brisket & sausage w/ mac&cheese and...the pecan coleslaw? What the heck for $18.  
Pulled pork sandwich $10
2 meat with pork and brisket
Ranch House Salad
Corn bread (pucks) of sweet, warm goodness.

Sides were great! The beans with zest, the M&C takes me back to old school cafeteria, the potato salad was fantastic and the slaw was great with the pecan.
Brisket was the clear winner from the table and we all loved the smoky sausage. The pulled pork was a disappointing third as it was dry. Good thing I went with brisket.
Two thumbs up here kids. Well worth your time and money. Yelp check in brought a 10% off the total tab too.

author: Sandy K.
review text:
possibly the BEST bbq I've ever had!
First of all the portions are huge! my boyfriend and I thought shared a whole hog heaven would be perfect for us, but we barely finished half of it! their meat is so well cooked, the rib meat falls right off the bone and the brisket melts in your mouth like cotton candy. The mash potato as a side dish is a must too! The complementary cinnamon donut are also a delight, as full as you will be after the meal, you will definitely have stomach for those little donuts!
The staff here are very professional and friendly.Our waitress was very helpful in answering our questions on the menu and checked up on us every so often to make sure we are satisfied with everything. Great restaurant!!

author: Sharon M.
review text: Had a great experience, out server was attentive and always checked up on us. The manager even introduced herself to us , the atmosphere is great as well as the people . The food is amazing, fresh and great in taste , my boyfriend got the brisket, theres no need for a knife , you can basically pull it off. The fried chicken is crispy on the outside but juicy on the inside . The artichoke dip with the garlic bread is a must get , got a little kick to it. They even gave us doughnut balls coated in brown sugar on our way out. I'm definitely coming back

author: Mark S.
review text:
I have not been here in a long time, and man Bobby Q's has really stepped up their game. Same location, same awesome feel with better food and service.

We had a great time! The baby back rips were spot on, the pulled pork was nice and moist, and the brisket had very little fat on it. The side were all fantastic as well. Extra cheesy Mac and Cheese and fluffy mashed potato's. This was all washed down with there house beer, which was a Red from Sedona Brewing. No complaints at all on the food.

The service was also great! My pops was in town from Florida so we all went out and our server was more then accommodating the kids and all of our needs. He did a fantastic job, and had several other tables besides ours.

Plus you get a little bonus before and after your meal. Bonus number 1, 10% off your bill when you do a yelp check in. Bonus 2, corn bread brought to you before your meal. Bonus 3, after your meal you get cinnamon  donuts.

I am looking forward to going back and thankfully this is one of the few BBQ places that is a reasonable distance from my house.

author: Amber S.
review text: We had a big family dinner here Friday night (14 people) and had such a great experience!! The Q rolls are one of the yummiest things I've ever eaten; I had filet and my boyfriend had the ribs & various meat platter and it was all SO GOOD. I see why this restaurant has such great ratings, the fresh donuts at the end of the meal just top it off. We'll be back soon for sure

author: Valentin B.
review text:
Very good service and very good food. The place is nicely decorated and the whole meal is affordable. The food is very tasty and very well cooked.

As a French, my only regret was on the chicken: although the sauce was very tasty, I believe that the quality of the meat was rather poor. But I guess it is complicated to find a good "poulet fermier" (free range chicken) in the US ;-)

author: Trisha J.
review text:
This quite popular BBQ joint in North Phoenix is easy to miss off the freeway, but once you arrive you wondered how you could have ever missed it!  

This restaurant has a simple menu, fair prices, wonderful Happy Hour specials and FREE Cinnamon Sugar Donuts for all!!  (Get an extra bag to go!)

You can't go wrong with anything you order here.  All meats, chicken and fish too, are moist, tender, seasoned very well and are very filling.  My favorite side dishes there are the macaroni and cheese (da bomb!), Pecan Coleslaw (yes...Pecan!) and their shoestring French fries, with BBQ Sauce as a dip!  

That's all well and good, but what keeps me coming back is their BRISKET!!  Hot damn!  Lean, tender, juicy and addictive!!  You'll be dreaming of Bobby Q Brisket in your dreams that night!  Their Brisket, Ribs and PRIME RIB (ahhh) are the top three sellers at Bobby Q!

They have a WONDERFUL lunch menu, but what I like is that they don't skimp on serving size for lunches.  You get a ton of meat and normal size side dish.  You just pay a few dollars less.  That's always good.

Don't forget the FREE Cinnamon Sugar Donuts at the end of your meal.  Grab an extra bag of them as you leave.  I've also seen people grab a bag of them as they go in as well!  No one there will tell you that you will spoil your meal by doing that so have at it!

author: Damion W.
review text:
Anyone that knows anything about BBQ and large chain restaurants knows that it is extremely hard to mass produce BBQ and still make it delicious. For this very reason I was skeptical about going to Bobby Q. Then I looked at the ratings and saw that the restaurant has a greater than 4 star rating. I HAD TO GIVE IT A SHOT!

I ordered the full rack of ribs and loaded baked potato with mac and cheese on the side. WHOA! I must say that Bobby Q thoroughly impressed me! The smokey taste and tenderness of the ribs was out of control. Not to mention, when I was done, I was full as a tick! I actually thought I was the one in the back of the restaurant Q'ing it up on the smoker. But after I woke up from my daydream, I realized that Bobby Q is or SHOULD BE a staple in the greater Phoenix area.

When I come back to Phoenix, this is definitely one of the restaurants that I will have to indulge in a repeat visit, just to make sure I wasn't in a dream of bliss and desire.

Bobby Q's... Phoenix is supposed to be well known for Mexican food and taco shops, well, my friends, you have made your mark, I will remember Bobby Q's for BBQ!

author: Camille K.
review text:
Baby back and St Louis sale ribs are awesome. Love the coleslaws and baked potatoes.  Will sure be back next time we are in town!!!

Corn bread is also very very good!!!

author: Lala T.
review text:
Bobby Q BBQ. Clever. The restaurant had me at the name but it didn't hurt that they made Yelps 100 places to eat list. What does one do when they find themselves in Phoenix for the first time ever? Head over to Bobbie Q, of course. I came here for one reason and one reason only. Baby back ribs. I do love my baby backs. There is a pretty large parking lot to fit all the hungry BBQ lovers in one place. As I walked in and smelled the smoky goodness, the hostess in the front handed my party of three a bag of freshly made cinnamon sugar donuts while we waited a few short minutes for a table. Like a child who's been offered desert before dinner, I gleefully followed the hostess to our table whilst munching on my sugary donuts. Our waiter took our drink orders and I decided on the baby backs with a side of potato salad and mac and cheese.

After what seemed like a forever of eyeing and sniffing my neighbors meals, our plates came out. The full rack of baby backs were huge. The photo does not do it justice. Talk about a bang for your buck! They smelled amazing as the smokey aroma filled my lungs. I went in with my knife and realized how easy the cut was. There is hours of love put into these ribs because the first bite just melted in my mouth. The best thing about these ribs...they are not overly sauced. You can ask for extra BBQ and add as needed, but the meat is not masked with sauce. I got through about half of the tender rack of ribs before I realized that I still had two bowls piled high with mac and cheese and potato salad. I used the complimentary corn bread with butter to create potato salad and mac and cheese sammies and inhaled my sides. The mac and cheese was so creamy with a distinct sharp cheddar flavor. I wish that the cheese was a little more gooey than creamy, but the flavors where there. The potato salad had good flavor and great textures. It paired really well with the sweet cornbread. Heads up, this place won't do you well if you are on the diet. This is one cheat meal you will not regret.

The service was pretty impressive. Our waiter gave suggestions and replaced our drinks with new ones before we finished the original. Our food was served hot and when we were tipping over from being too full, he brought out to go boxes to pile our leftovers in. One of the managers was walking around in the restaurant and checking on tables throughout our meal. We gave kudos to the chef when he asked us about our experience. I didn't imagine Phoenix to be known for BBQ, but I was not disappointed with what I got. The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating (with a sprinkling cooling system) with big enough tables to feel at ease. As I walked out, another bag of cinnamon donuts were handed to me and I vouched to be back. 5/5 overall experience!

author: Vincent E.
review text: Some of the best BBQ I've ever had. And I've been to Kansas City. Low and slow cooking. Beautiful smoky flavor. The ribs were meaty and tender. The brisket was moist and beefy.
